analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rin chen 'byung ldan gyi dkyil 'khor du //

analyzed: rdo rje rin chen sku mdog ser po rang gi dbang bskur ba'i gnas su /

analyzed: phyag gnyis yid bzhin nor bu'i rgyal mtshan bsnams pa'o //

analyzed: so'i phreng ba gnyis dang ldan pa'i rdo rje gnyis pa bsnams pa'o //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag tu med pa'i dkyil 'khor du rdo rje chos sku mdog dmar skya //

analyzed: phyag g-yon pas thugs kar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i glegs bam bsnams pa'o //

analyzed: rdo rje rgyu sku mdog gser gyi mdog can chos kyi 'khor lo'i phyag rgya dang ldan pa'o //

analyzed: phyag g-yon pas dung bsnams pa'o //

translated: In the mandala of Bhagavat Amoghasiddhi,🔽Vajrakarma is green in color and holds a three-pronged vajra in his two hands, which he places on his head. He dances in order to make offerings to the tathagatas.

analyzed: rdo rje srung ba sku mdog ser po phyag gnyis kyis rdo rje go cha bsnams pa'o //

translated: Vajrayaksha is black in color, with two hands holding two fangs in his mouth, and he abides in the terror of all evildoers.

analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur sku mdog dkar po phyag gnyis kyis rdo rje khu tshur bsdams nas bzhugs pa'o //

analyzed: mtshams rnams su spyan ni 'jam pa'i dbyangs dang 'dra'o //

analyzed: gos dkar mo ni 'od dpag tu med pa dang 'dra'o //

analyzed: sgrol ma ni don yod par grub pa dong 'dra'o //
translated: TARA is like Amoghasiddhi.

analyzed: rin po che'i gtso mo dang / ratna'i sgrol ma dang / rgyal mtshan rtse mo'i dpung rgyan dang / bkod pa dang ldan ma dang bzhi ni ratna'i rigs kyi'o //
translated: The four Ratnasambhava goddesses are Ratnatārā, Ratnatārā, Ketudhvaja, and Ketumālā.

original: rdo rje sa mo dang kun du 'khor lo ma dang rlan 'dzin ma dang / stong du zlos ma bzhi padma'o rigs kyi'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sa mo dang kun du 'khor lo ma dang rlan 'dzin ma dang / stong du zlos ma bzhi padma'o rigs kyi'o //
translated: The four goddesses of the Padma family are Vajrasenā, Samantā, Megha, and Sahasrā.

original: dngos grub kyi rtse mo dang / thams cad bsrung ma dang / mdangs slar 'phrog ma dang / gzungs kyi phyag rgya rnams dang bzhi ni las kyi rigs kyi'o //
analyzed: dngos grub kyi rtse mo dang / thams cad bsrung ma dang / mdangs slar 'phrog ma dang / gzungs kyi phyag rgya rnams dang bzhi ni las kyi rigs kyi'o //
translated: The four goddesses of the Karma family are Siddhiśekhara, Viśvavarā, Ojasvinī, and Dhāraṇīmudrā.

original: sku mdog phyag mtshan sems dpa' bcu drug dang mthun no //
analyzed: sku mdog phyag mtshan sems dpa' bcu drug dang mthun no //
translated: Their colors and implements are the same as the sixteen male bodhisattvas.

original: @159a * // 'di'i lugs kyis spyan ma la rdo rje rigs kyi sems dpas bskor //
analyzed: @159a * // 'di'i lugs kyis spyan ma la rdo rje rigs kyi sems dpas bskor //
translated: In this system, Locanā is surrounded by the bodhisattvas of the Vajra family.

original: m'a ma k'i la rin po che'i rigs kyi sems dpa' bzhis bskor //
analyzed: m'a ma k'i la rin po che'i rigs kyi sems dpa' bzhis bskor //
translated: Māmakī is surrounded by the four bodhisattvas of the Ratna family.

original: gzhan gnyis po yang rigs mthu par bskor ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gnyis po yang rigs mthu par bskor ba'o //
translated: The other two are surrounded by the bodhisattvas of their respective families.

analyzed: 'dir rdo rje thig gi nang longs su ri mo zur bzhi pa byas pa'i brgyad cha'i sgo ste rta babs med pa'o //
translated: Here, the inner area within the vajra lines is divided into four corners, with a gate in each side, without archways.

original: lhag ma ni phyi'i dkyil 'khor ro //🔽de'i shar gyi sgor rdo rje lcags kyu sku mdog dkar po rdo rje lcags kyu bsnams pa g-yas brkyang bas bzhugs pa'o //🔽lho'i sgor rdo rje zhags pa sku mdog ser po phyag na rdo rje zhags pa bsnams pa g-yon brkyang bas bzhugs pa'o //

original: nub kyi sgor rdo rje lcags sgrog sku mdog dmar po phyag gnyis kyis rdo rje lu gu rgyud bsnams pa sa ga'i 'dug stangs kyis bzhugs pa'o //

translated: At the western gate is Vajra chain, red in color, holding a vajra chain with both hands, standing in the posture of royal poise.

original: byang phyogs kyi sgor rdo rje 'bebs pa sku mdog ljang gu phyag gnyis kyis rdo rje bsdams pas rdo rje dang dril bu bsnams pa zlum po'i 'dug stabs kyis bzhugs par bri bar bya ste nang gi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: byang phyogs kyi sgor rdo rje 'bebs pa sku mdog ljang gu phyag gnyis kyis rdo rje bsdams pas rdo rje dang dril bu bsnams pa zlum po'i 'dug stabs kyis bzhugs par bri bar bya ste nang gi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: At the northern gate one should paint Vajra-Amogha, green in color, holding a vajra and a bell in his two hands in the gesture of binding, seated in the half-lotus posture. This is the inner maṇḍala.

original: gnyis pa nang gi dkyil 'khor gyi nyis 'gyur te gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa nang gi dkyil 'khor gyi nyis 'gyur te gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The second is the double of the inner maṇḍala, the maṇḍala of dhāraṇī.

original: gnyis pa der yang shar phyogs su sa bcu gnyis bri bar bya ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa der yang shar phyogs su sa bcu gnyis bri bar bya ste /
translated: There, too, one should draw the twelve stages in the east.

original: kun kyang sna tshogs padma la sems dpa'i skyil mo krung gis bzhugs pa //
analyzed: kun kyang sna tshogs padma la sems dpa'i skyil mo krung gis bzhugs pa //
translated: All of them are seated in the cross-legged vajra posture on variegated lotuses,

original: rin po che'i dbu rgyan can //
analyzed: rin po che'i dbu rgyan can //
translated: wearing jeweled crowns,

original: phyag g-yas na rdo rje bsnams pa //
analyzed: phyag g-yas na rdo rje bsnams pa //
translated: with the right hand holding a vajra,

original: phyag g-yon na rang gi mtshan ma bsnams pa'o //

translated: In the north gate corner is Vajra Taste Goddess, multicolored, holding a taste vessel.

original: rdo rje shugs kyis byung la phyi rol gyi rdo rje rigs kyi dkyil 'khor du dbang ldan gyi phyogs nas brtsams te /
analyzed: rdo rje shugs kyis byung la phyi rol gyi rdo rje rigs kyi dkyil 'khor du dbang ldan gyi phyogs nas brtsams te /
translated: One should draw Brahmā and so forth in the outer maṇḍala of the Vajra family, beginning from the northeast,

original: yongs su bskor bar tshangs pa la sogs pa go rims ji lta ba bzhin du bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su bskor bar tshangs pa la sogs pa go rims ji lta ba bzhin du bri bar bya'o //
translated: in order, surrounding the maṇḍala.

original: de la byang shar mtshams su dbang ldan mdog dkar po ral pa dang cod pan yod pa /
analyzed: de la byang shar mtshams su dbang ldan mdog dkar po ral pa dang cod pan yod pa /
translated: There, in the northeast, one should draw Indra, white in color, with matted hair and a crown,

original: kha tv'am ga rtse gsum pa thod pa 'dzin pa /
analyzed: kha tv'am ga rtse gsum pa thod pa 'dzin pa /
translated: holding a khaṭvāṅga and a skull-cup,

original: lag pa gnyis kyis thal mo sbyar nas mgor bzhag pa ste /
analyzed: lag pa gnyis kyis thal mo sbyar nas mgor bzhag pa ste /
translated: with his two hands folded in añjali at his head.

original: bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal ba /
translated: He should be drawn bowing in homage to the Blessed One,

original: khyu mchog la zhon pa /
analyzed: khyu mchog la zhon pa /
translated: riding a bull,

original: lha mo / au ma dang bcas pa dkyil 'khor la mngon du phyogs par bri'o //
analyzed: lha mo / au ma dang bcas pa dkyil 'khor la mngon du phyogs par bri'o //
translated: together with the goddess Umā, facing the maṇḍala.

original: de bzhin du thams cad kyang phyag 'tshal ba'i thal mos 'dud par byed pa la mchog tu gzhol ba /
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad kyang phyag 'tshal ba'i thal mos 'dud par byed pa la mchog tu gzhol ba /
translated: Similarly, all of them should be drawn bowing with folded hands, devoted to the supreme,

original: dkyil 'khor la mngon par phyogs par bri'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor la mngon par phyogs par bri'o //
translated: facing the maṇḍala.

original: de la 'jig rten skyong ba brgyad ni phyogs dang mtshams rnams su bri bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten skyong ba brgyad ni phyogs dang mtshams rnams su bri bar bya ste /
translated: The eight Lokapālas should be painted in the directions and intermediate directions.

original: shar du brgya byin mdog ser po rdo rje thogs pa /
analyzed: shar du brgya byin mdog ser po rdo rje thogs pa /
translated: In the east, Indra, yellow in color, holding a vajra,

original: glang po che dkar po la zhon pa chung ma dang bcas pa bri'o //
analyzed: glang po che dkar po la zhon pa chung ma dang bcas pa bri'o //
translated: should be painted mounted on a white elephant, together with his wife.

original: shar lhor me lha mdog dmar po lag pa bzhi pa /
analyzed: shar lhor me lha mdog dmar po lag pa bzhi pa /
translated: In the southeast, Agni, red in color, with four arms,

original: g-yas gnyis na blugs gzar dang dbyug pa thogs pa /
analyzed: g-yas gnyis na blugs gzar dang dbyug pa thogs pa /
translated: holding in the two right hands a ladle and a club,

original: yon gnyis phreng ba dang gundhe thogs par skyes la zhon pa chung ma dang bcas pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: yon gnyis phreng ba dang gundhe thogs par skyes la zhon pa chung ma dang bcas pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: and in the two left a rosary and a water vessel, should be painted mounted on a ram, together with his wife.

original: phyag 'tshal ba'i thal mo ni thams cad kyi thun mong ma yin pas so sor ma smras so //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal ba'i thal mo ni thams cad kyi thun mong ma yin pas so sor ma smras so //
translated: The gesture of salutation is not mentioned separately for all, as it is common to all.

original: lhor gshin rje mdog nag mo dbyug pa dang mdung thung thogs pa /
analyzed: lhor gshin rje mdog nag mo dbyug pa dang mdung thung thogs pa /
translated: In the south, Yama, black in color, holding a club and a javelin,

original: ma he la zhon pa chung ma dang bcas pa bri'o //
analyzed: ma he la zhon pa chung ma dang bcas pa bri'o //
translated: should be painted mounted on a water buffalo, together with his wife.

original: lho nub tu srin po'i bdag po mdog sngon po lag na ral gri dang phub thogs pa /
analyzed: lho nub tu srin po'i bdag po mdog sngon po lag na ral gri dang phub thogs pa /
translated: In the southwest, the Lord of Rākṣasas, blue in color, holding a sword and a shield,🔽should be painted mounted on a buffalo, together with his wife.

original: mi ro la zhon pa chung ma dang bcas pa bri'o //
analyzed: mi ro la zhon pa chung ma dang bcas pa bri'o //
translated: Draw him mounted on a human corpse, together with his wife.

original: nub tu cha lha mdog dkar po gyas dang gyon gnyis na dung dang sbrul gyi zhags pa thogs pa//
analyzed: nub tu cha lha mdog dkar po gyas dang gyon gnyis na dung dang sbrul gyi zhags pa thogs pa//
translated: In the west, draw the god of the directions, white in color, holding a conch and a snake noose in his two hands,

original: chu srin la zhon pa gdongs ka bdun pa chung ma dang bcas pa bri'o //
analyzed: chu srin la zhon pa gdongs ka bdun pa chung ma dang bcas pa bri'o //
translated: mounted on a crocodile, with seven faces, together with his wife.

original: nub byang du rlung lha nam mkha'i mdog can lag pa gnyis na ba dan thogs pa ri dags la zhon pa chung ma dang bcas pa bri'o //
analyzed: nub byang du rlung lha nam mkha'i mdog can lag pa gnyis na ba dan thogs pa ri dags la zhon pa chung ma dang bcas pa bri'o //
translated: In the northwest, draw the wind god, the color of the sky, holding a banner in his two hands, mounted on a deer, together with his wife.

original: byang du lus ngan po gser gyi mdog can g-yas na lcags kyu thogs pa /
analyzed: byang du lus ngan po gser gyi mdog can g-yas na lcags kyu thogs pa /
translated: In the north, draw Kubera, golden in color, holding a hook in his right hand,

original: g-yon na dbyug ba thogs pa mi la zhon pa chung ma dang btsas par bri'o //
analyzed: g-yon na dbyug ba thogs pa mi la zhon pa chung ma dang btsas par bri'o //
translated: holding a club in his left hand, mounted on a human, together with his wife and son.

original: 'di dag gi chung @164b ma rnams kyi mdog la sogs pa ni de rang rang gi khyod dang 'dra par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag gi chung @164b ma rnams kyi mdog la sogs pa ni de rang rang gi khyod dang 'dra par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The colors and so forth of their wives should be seen as the same as their respective husbands.

original: dbang ldan dang nye bar tshangs pa mdog ser po gdong bzhi pa /
analyzed: dbang ldan dang nye bar tshangs pa mdog ser po gdong bzhi pa /
translated: Near Indra, draw Brahmā, yellow in color, with four faces,

original: lag pa bzhi pa /
analyzed: lag pa bzhi pa /
translated: with four hands,

original: lag pa gnyis na pad ma dang phreng ba thogs nas phyag 'tshal ba'i thal mo sbyar te /
analyzed: lag pa gnyis na pad ma dang phreng ba thogs nas phyag 'tshal ba'i thal mo sbyar te /
translated: In his two other hands he holds a lotus and a garland, and he makes the gesture of salutation with his two other hands.

original: 'jog pa de las gzhan pa gnyis kyis dbyug pa dang spyi blugs 'dzin pa /
analyzed: 'jog pa de las gzhan pa gnyis kyis dbyug pa dang spyi blugs 'dzin pa /
translated: In his two other hands he holds a club and a water vessel.

original: ngang pa la gzhon pa chung ma dang bcas pa'i 'khor gyis bskor bar bri'o //🔽de'i 'og tu khyab 'jug mdog nag mo lag pa bzhi pa gyas dang gyon gnyis kyis 'khor lo dang mdung thogs nas spyi bar thal mo sbyar te 'jog pa /
analyzed: ngang pa la gzhon pa chung ma dang bcas pa'i 'khor gyis bskor bar bri'o // de'i 'og tu khyab 'jug mdog nag mo lag pa bzhi pa gyas dang gyon gnyis kyis 'khor lo dang mdung thogs nas spyi bar thal mo sbyar te 'jog pa /
translated: He is drawn surrounded by a retinue of young geese and his wife.🔽Below him is Vishnu, black in color, with four hands. In his two upper hands he holds a discus and a spear, and he makes the gesture of salutation with his two other hands.

original: de las gzhan pa gnyis kyis sha ra'i gzhu dang da byug pa 'dzin pa nam mkha' lding la zhon pa chung ma dang bcas pa'i 'khor gyis bskor bar bri'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa gnyis kyis sha ra'i gzhu dang da byug pa 'dzin pa nam mkha' lding la zhon pa chung ma dang bcas pa'i 'khor gyis bskor bar bri'o //
translated: In his two other hands he holds a bow and a perfume shell, and he is drawn mounted on Garuda, surrounded by a retinue of his wife and so forth.

original: dbang phyug chen po mdog dkar po lag pa gnyis na thod pa dang / rtse gsum thogs te thal mo sbyar ba zla ba'i rtse bran thogs pa khyu mchog la zhon pa chung ma'i tshogs dang bcas pas yongs su bskor bar bri'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug chen po mdog dkar po lag pa gnyis na thod pa dang / rtse gsum thogs te thal mo sbyar ba zla ba'i rtse bran thogs pa khyu mchog la zhon pa chung ma'i tshogs dang bcas pas yongs su bskor bar bri'o //
translated: Mahêśvara is white in color, holding a skull and a trident in his two hands, with palms joined, holding a moon-crested ornament, riding a bull, and surrounded by a host of wives.

original: gzhon nu k'arti ka mdog dmar po byis pa'i gzugs can dong drug pa /
analyzed: gzhon nu k'arti ka mdog dmar po byis pa'i gzugs can dong drug pa /
translated: Kārttikeya is red in color, with the form of a youth, six-faced,

original: lag pa drug pa lag pa gnyis kyis thal mo sbyar ba byas la /
analyzed: lag pa drug pa lag pa gnyis kyis thal mo sbyar ba byas la /
translated: with six hands, with two hands joined in añjali,

original: yang lag pa gnyis na mdung thung dang rdo rje thogs pa /
analyzed: yang lag pa gnyis na mdung thung dang rdo rje thogs pa /
translated: with two hands holding a spear and a vajra,

original: yang gnyis na khyim bya dang / dril bu thogs pa rma bya la zho zhon par bri'o //
analyzed: yang gnyis na khyim bya dang / dril bu thogs pa rma bya la zho zhon par bri'o //
translated: and with two hands holding a cock and a bell, riding a peacock.

original: nag po chen po mdog po mdung rtse gsum pa dang thod pa thogs pa'o //
analyzed: nag po chen po mdog po mdung rtse gsum pa dang thod pa thogs pa'o //
translated: Mahākāla is black in color, holding a trident and a skull.

original: dga' byed dbang phyug ni mdog nag po rdza rnga brdung ba la brtson pa rdza rnga la zhon pa'o //
analyzed: dga' byed dbang phyug ni mdog nag po rdza rnga brdung ba la brtson pa rdza rnga la zhon pa'o //
translated: Ananga is black in color, striving to beat a clay drum, riding a clay drum.

original: nyi ma ni mdog dmar po lag pa gnyis na pad ma la gnas pa /
analyzed: nyi ma ni mdog dmar po lag pa gnyis na pad ma la gnas pa /
translated: Sūrya is red in color, with two hands holding a lotus,

original: nyi ma'i kyis 'khor thogs pa rtas drangs pa'i shing rta la zhon pa'o /
analyzed: nyi ma'i kyis 'khor thogs pa rtas drangs pa'i shing rta la zhon pa'o /
translated: The sun is drawn by seven horses.🔽The moon is white in color and rides on a deer.

original: zla ba ni mdog dkar po lag pa gnyis na padma'i steng du zla ba'i dkyil 'khor thogs pa dang pa la zhon pa'o //
analyzed: zla ba ni mdog dkar po lag pa gnyis na padma'i steng du zla ba'i dkyil 'khor thogs pa dang pa la zhon pa'o //
translated: In his two hands he holds a moon disc on a lotus.🔽Mars is red in color and rides on a ram.

original: mig dmar ni mdog dmar po la lag pa rgyas pa na chu gri thogs pa /
analyzed: mig dmar ni mdog dmar po la lag pa rgyas pa na chu gri thogs pa /
translated: In his two hands he holds a sword.

original: lag pa gyon pa na mi mgo za bar byed pa glang po che la zhon pa'o //
analyzed: lag pa gyon pa na mi mgo za bar byed pa glang po che la zhon pa'o //
translated: He eats human heads with his hands.🔽Mercury is yellow in color and rides on a lotus.

original: gza' lag ni mdog ser po lag na mda' gzhung thogs pa pad ma la 'dug pa'o //🔽phur bu mdog dkar po lag na phreng ba dang spyi blugs thogs pa pad ma la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gza' lag ni mdog ser po lag na mda' gzhung thogs pa pad ma la 'dug pa'o // phur bu mdog dkar po lag na phreng ba dang spyi blugs thogs pa pad ma la gnas pa'o //
translated: In his two hands he holds an arrow and a bow.🔽Jupiter is white in color and rides on a lotus.🔽In his two hands he holds a rosary and a water pot.

original: pa ba bsangs mdog dkar po phreng ba dang gu ne dha thogs pa bum pa la 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: pa ba bsangs mdog dkar po phreng ba dang gu ne dha thogs pa bum pa la 'dug pa'o //
translated: Venus is white in color and rides on a water pot.🔽In his two hands he holds a rosary and a guṇeḍha.

original: spen pa mdog nag po dbyug pa thogs pa rus sbal la zhon pa'o //🔽sgra gcan @165a * //
analyzed: spen pa mdog nag po dbyug pa thogs pa rus sbal la zhon pa'o // sgra gcan @165a * //
translated: Saturn is black in color and rides on a tortoise.🔽In his two hands he holds a club.

original: mdog dmar nag lag na nyi zla thogs pa'o //
analyzed: mdog dmar nag lag na nyi zla thogs pa'o //
translated: Rahu is dark red in color and holds the sun and moon in his two hands.

original: mjug rings mdog nag po ral gri dang sbrul gyi zhags pa thogs pa'o //
analyzed: mjug rings mdog nag po ral gri dang sbrul gyi zhags pa thogs pa'o //
translated: The last one is black, holding a sword and a snake-lasso.

original: stobs bzang mdog nag po ral gri dang gshol thogs pa glang po che la zhon pa'o //
analyzed: stobs bzang mdog nag po ral gri dang gshol thogs pa glang po che la zhon pa'o //
translated: Bhadrapada is black, holding a sword and a plow, and he rides an elephant.

original: rgyal bar byed pa mdog ljang gu me tig gi phreng ba dang / mda' dang gzhu dang kham phor thogs pa //
analyzed: rgyal bar byed pa mdog ljang gu me tig gi phreng ba dang / mda' dang gzhu dang kham phor thogs pa //
translated: Jaya is green, holding a garland of myrobalan, an arrow, a bow, and a saucer.

original: ko gi la'i shing rta la zhon pa'o //🔽sbrang rtsir byed pa mdog dkar po lag na chu srin gyi rgyal mtshan dang / mda' dang gzhu dang kham phor thogs pa ni tsho'i khri la zhon pa'o //
analyzed: ko gi la'i shing rta la zhon pa'o // sbrang rtsir byed pa mdog dkar po lag na chu srin gyi rgyal mtshan dang / mda' dang gzhu dang kham phor thogs pa ni tsho'i khri la zhon pa'o //
translated: He rides a cart drawn by oxen.🔽Madhu is white, holding a makara banner, an arrow, a bow, and a saucer, and he rides a lion throne.

original: dpyid kyi lha mdog dkar po lag na mda' dang gzhu dang / kham phor dang ral gri thogs pa sprin la zhon pa'o //
analyzed: dpyid kyi lha mdog dkar po lag na mda' dang gzhu dang / kham phor dang ral gri thogs pa sprin la zhon pa'o //
translated: Vasanta is white, holding an arrow, a bow, a saucer, and a sword, and he rides on a cloud.

original: mtha' yas dang nor rgyas dang / 'jog po dang / stobs kyi rgyu dang / padma dang / padma chen po dang / dung skyong dang / rigs ldan te klu'i rgyal po brgyad de gdengs ka bdun bdun dang ldan pa //
analyzed: mtha' yas dang nor rgyas dang / 'jog po dang / stobs kyi rgyu dang / padma dang / padma chen po dang / dung skyong dang / rigs ldan te klu'i rgyal po brgyad de gdengs ka bdun bdun dang ldan pa //
translated: Ananta, Vāsuki, Takṣaka, Kulika, Padma, Mahāpadma, Śaṅkhapāla, and Śaṅkhapāṇi—these are the eight nāga kings, each with seven hoods.

original: thal mo sbyar ba byas pa bri'o //
analyzed: thal mo sbyar ba byas pa bri'o //
translated: They should be depicted with palms joined.

original: de la mtha' yas dang / rings ldan gnyis ni bram ze'i rigs te mdog dmar po me lha'i bu'o //
analyzed: de la mtha' yas dang / rings ldan gnyis ni bram ze'i rigs te mdog dmar po me lha'i bu'o //
translated: Among them, Ananta and Vāsuki belong to the brahmin caste, are red in color, and are the sons of Agni.

original: nor rgyas dang dung skyong gnyis ni rgyal rigs te /
analyzed: nor rgyas dang dung skyong gnyis ni rgyal rigs te /
translated: Vāsuki and Śaṅkhapāla belong to the kṣatriya caste,

original: mdog ser po brgya byin gyi bu'o //
analyzed: mdog ser po brgya byin gyi bu'o //
translated: are yellow in color, and are the sons of Indra.

original: 'dzog po dang padma chen po gnyis ni da mngas rigs te mdog nag po rlung lha'i bu'o //
analyzed: 'dzog po dang padma chen po gnyis ni da mngas rigs te mdog nag po rlung lha'i bu'o //
translated: Takṣaka and Mahāpadma belong to the vaiśya caste, are black in color, and are the sons of Vāyu.

original: stobs kyi rgyu dang padma gnyis ni rje'u rigs te /
analyzed: stobs kyi rgyu dang padma gnyis ni rje'u rigs te /
translated: Kulika and Padma belong to the śūdra caste,

original: mdog dkar po chu lha'i bu'o //
analyzed: mdog dkar po chu lha'i bu'o //
translated: are white in color, and are the sons of Varuṇa.

original: de dag kyang 'khor dang bcas pa bri'i //
analyzed: de dag kyang 'khor dang bcas pa bri'i //
translated: They should all be depicted with retinues.

original: thags bzangs ris dang stobs ldan dang / rab dga' dang / rnam par sang byed la sogs pa'i lha ma yin gyi dbang po rnams ni mdog nag po ral gri dang phub la sogs pa mtshon cha sna tshogs pa lag na go cha gon zhing chas pa 'khor dang bcas pa bri'o //
analyzed: thags bzangs ris dang stobs ldan dang / rab dga' dang / rnam par sang byed la sogs pa'i lha ma yin gyi dbang po rnams ni mdog nag po ral gri dang phub la sogs pa mtshon cha sna tshogs pa lag na go cha gon zhing chas pa 'khor dang bcas pa bri'o //
translated: The asura lords such as Vemacitrin, Bali, Santuṣita, and Vemacitrin should be drawn with dark complexions, holding various weapons such as swords and spears, wearing armor and accouterments, and accompanied by retinues.

original: nam mkha' lding gi dbang po rnams ni gshog rgyang ring ba kha dog sna tshogs pa pus mo'i lha nga'i bar du kha ba dkar ba //
analyzed: nam mkha' lding gi dbang po rnams ni gshog rgyang ring ba kha dog sna tshogs pa pus mo'i lha nga'i bar du kha ba dkar ba //
translated: The garuḍa lords should be drawn with long wings, various colors, and beaks reaching down to their knees.

original: de'i steng su lte ba'i khung bu la thug gi bar du gser gyi mdog can //
analyzed: de'i steng su lte ba'i khung bu la thug gi bar du gser gyi mdog can //
translated: Above that, from the navel to the throat, they should be drawn with a golden color.

original: de nas lkog ma'i bar du nyi ma 'char mdog can //
analyzed: de nas lkog ma'i bar du nyi ma 'char mdog can //
translated: From there, up to the Adam’s apple, they should be drawn with a rising sun color.

original: de nas klad pa'i steng gi mthar thig par ma lus par aanydz'a na bcag pa lta bu'i mdog can /
analyzed: de nas klad pa'i steng gi mthar thig par ma lus par aanydz'a na bcag pa lta bu'i mdog can /
translated: Then, above the head, up to the very end, they should be drawn with the color of crushed añjana, completely without gaps.

original: nam mkha' lding du mas yongs su bskor ba'i bri'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' lding du mas yongs su bskor ba'i bri'o //
translated: They should be drawn surrounded by many garuḍas.

original: mi 'am ci'i rgyal po ljon pa ni mdog dmar skya //
analyzed: mi 'am ci'i rgyal po ljon pa ni mdog dmar skya //
translated: The kinnara king Druma should be drawn with a reddish-brown complexion.

original: lag na po wang thogs pa rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa //
analyzed: lag na po wang thogs pa rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa //
translated: He should be drawn holding a lute and adorned with all the ornaments.

original: mi 'am ci'i rgyal po du mas yongs su bskor bar bri'o //
analyzed: mi 'am ci'i rgyal po du mas yongs su bskor bar bri'o //
translated: He should be drawn surrounded by many kinnara kings.

original: dri za'i rgyal po gtsug phud lda pa @165b ni gser gyi mdog can rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: dri za'i rgyal po gtsug phud lda pa @165b ni gser gyi mdog can rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
translated: The gandharva king Śikhindhara should be drawn with a golden complexion and adorned with all the ornaments.

original: dri za'i rgyal po du mas yongs su bskor bar bri'o //
analyzed: dri za'i rgyal po du mas yongs su bskor bar bri'o //
translated: He should be drawn surrounded by many gandharva kings.

original: rig pa 'dzin pa'i dbang po'i rgyal po don thams cad grub pa ni gser btso ma lta bu'i mdog can /
analyzed: rig pa 'dzin pa'i dbang po'i rgyal po don thams cad grub pa ni gser btso ma lta bu'i mdog can /
translated: The vidyādhara lord king Sarvārthasiddha should be drawn with the complexion of refined gold,

original: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
translated: adorned with all the ornaments,

original: rig pa 'dzin pa'i rgyal po du mas yongs su bskor bar bri'o //
analyzed: rig pa 'dzin pa'i rgyal po du mas yongs su bskor bar bri'o //
translated: and surrounded by many vidyādhara kings.

original: gnod sbyin rnams kyang lag na panytsa pu ra dang ne'u le thogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnod sbyin rnams kyang lag na panytsa pu ra dang ne'u le thogs pa'o //
translated: The yakṣas should be drawn holding paṭṭikās and mongoose.

original: de la gang ba bzang po ni mdog sngon po /🔽nor bu bzang po ni mdog ser po /
analyzed: de la gang ba bzang po ni mdog sngon po / nor bu bzang po ni mdog ser po /
translated: Among them, Jambhala should be drawn blue,🔽Vasudharā yellow,

original: nor sbyin ni mdog dmar po /
analyzed: nor sbyin ni mdog dmar po /
translated: Vasuvīra red,🔽and

original: rnam thos sras ni mdog ser po pi tsi gu nda li mdog dmar po ki li mi li mdog ljang gu sgo'i dbang po mdog ser po /
analyzed: rnam thos sras ni mdog ser po pi tsi gu nda li mdog dmar po ki li mi li mdog ljang gu sgo'i dbang po mdog ser po /
translated: the sense organ of the door is yellow,

original: sbyong pa'i dbang po mdog ser po /
analyzed: sbyong pa'i dbang po mdog ser po /
translated: the sense organ of purification is yellow,

original: de ltar na nam mkha' ltar dri ma med pa shin tu yongs su dag pa chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi snying po'i dkyil 'khor chen po sems can thams cad kyi sangs rgyas nyid la sogs pa'i dngos grub ma lus shing /

translated: Thus, in the great maṇḍala of the essence of the pristine consciousness of the completely pure, stainless realm of phenomena, like space, the attainment of all sentient beings’ buddhahood, and so on, is accomplished without exception and without incompleteness.🔽In order to accomplish the desired result, such as buddhahood, and so on, the purpose of entering the maṇḍala, and so on, will be perfectly accomplished.

analyzed: ma tshad ba med par bsgrub pa la sangs rgyas nyid la sogs pa'i 'bras bu mngon par 'dod pa rnams kyi dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa la sogs pas mngon par 'dod pa'i don rdzogs par 'gyur pas dkyil 'khor bri bar bya ba'i phyir dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga
translated: In order to draw the maṇḍala, the maṇḍala ritual

analyzed: mdor bsdus nas bri bar bya'o // de nas sngar nam mkha' dri ma med pa shin tu yongs su dag pa //
translated: should be written concisely.🔽Then, the master who has previously been empowered and authorized in the great maṇḍala called the Essence of the Pristine Consciousness of the Realm of Phenomena, completely pure, stainless space,

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi snying po zhes bya ba'i dkyil 'khor chen por dbang bskur zhing rjes su gnang ba thob pa'i slob dpon gyis gang gi tshe /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi snying po zhes bya ba'i dkyil 'khor chen por dbang bskur zhing rjes su gnang ba thob pa'i slob dpon gyis gang gi tshe /

analyzed: slob mas lan gnyis lan gsum du gsol ba btab par gyur na //

analyzed: de'i tshe 'di ltar yid la bya ste /

analyzed: ngas chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyis bsdu bas sems can thams cad bsdu bar bya'o //

analyzed: 'di la yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub sbyin par bya'o zhes bsam mo //

original: gal te bdag 'tshal lo zhes zer na //
analyzed: gal te bdag 'tshal lo zhes zer na //

analyzed: des kyang dkyil 'khor gyi yo byad tshogs sam /

original: 'on te ma yin zhes dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te ma yin zhes dri bar bya'o //

original: gal te cung zad ni chogs so zer na /
analyzed: gal te cung zad ni chogs so zer na /

translated: And in the heart, one should imagine the syllable ka, the essence of the obscuration of karma.

original: bor bsams la yi ge h'um gi 'bar ba'i 'od kyis gyen du 'byin par byed cang sna bug g-yas pa nas nges par 'byung ba ni gcer bu gzugs mi sdug pa gsus pa 'phyang ba /

translated: The light of the blazing syllable hūṃ expels it, and it definitely emerges through the right nostril, as a naked, ugly form, with a protruding belly,

analyzed: skra gyen du brdzes pa byung ba dang / yi ge h'um yang snying gar phyin pa dang / rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi gzugs kyi snang bur de nyid nas byung nas @166b gsang sngags de za bar gyur par bsam par bya'o //
translated: and with hair standing upward. The syllable hūṃ also arrives in the heart, and one should imagine that the form of Vajrayakṣa emerges from that very place, and devours the mantra.

original: aom badzra yaksha kh'a da ya kh'a da ya //
analyzed: aom badzra yaksha kh'a da ya kh'a da ya //

original: sarba p'a pam a'a ba ra na a'a sya h'um phat /
analyzed: sarba p'a pam a'a ba ra na a'a sya h'um phat /

original: yang na h'um las byung ba'i ro stod khro bo'i gzugs la ro smad rdo rje rtse gcig pa'i dbyibs su gnas pa'i phur bus gsang sngags 'di dang de nyid du phur bus gdab bar bya'o //

translated: With this mantra, one should drive the dagger into the ground.

original: aom badzra k'i li k'i la ya //
analyzed: aom badzra k'i li k'i la ya //
translated: OṂ Vajra KĪLIKĪLA,

original: sarba bigh'am bandha bandha h'um phat //
analyzed: sarba bigh'am bandha bandha h'um phat //
translated: bind all the Vighnās, bind, HŪṀ Phat.

original: de nas slob ma de sam las byung ba'i kun du bzang po'i gzugs su bsams la /
analyzed: de nas slob ma de sam las byung ba'i kun du bzang po'i gzugs su bsams la /
translated: Then, one should imagine the disciple in the form of Samantabhadra arisen from the syllable SAM.

analyzed: de'i sbi bor ham phyung ba'i sna tshogs rdo rje bsrung ba'i don du bsam par bya ste //
translated: In his heart, one should imagine a variegated vajra arisen from the syllable HŪṀ, for the purpose of protection.

original: de ltar byas na mang gi bdag nyid can gyi bgegs rnams 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar byas na mang gi bdag nyid can gyi bgegs rnams 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does it in this way, the hosts of Vighnas will not arise.

original: yo byad ma tshogs pa rnams kyang bde blag tu tshang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yo byad ma tshogs pa rnams kyang bde blag tu tshang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And the lack of requisites will be easily fulfilled.

original: slob ma yongs su gzung ba'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: slob ma yongs su gzung ba'i cho ga'o //
translated: The ritual for taking on a disciple.

original: de nas rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi sbyor ba dang ldan pas grog mkhar gyis dang / skra dang phub ma la sogs pa las rang rang gi phyogs skyong gi gzugs brnyan bya ste /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi sbyor ba dang ldan pas grog mkhar gyis dang / skra dang phub ma la sogs pa las rang rang gi phyogs skyong gi gzugs brnyan bya ste /

original: dkyil 'khor gyi bgegs byed pa rnams sngags 'dis bkug la bcug ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi bgegs byed pa rnams sngags 'dis bkug la bcug ste /

original: bcings la phur bus legs par btab ste /
analyzed: bcings la phur bus legs par btab ste /
translated: Having well struck them with the kīla,

analyzed: h'um bzhi ba'i sngags bzlas pa'i yungs kar gyis bsnun la gzhag par bya'o //
translated: one should place them, having struck them with mustard seeds enchanted with the mantra of the four hūṃs.

analyzed: khro bo'i khu tshur gnyis rgyab sbyar ba byas la mthe'u chung gnyis lcags sgrog lta bur mdud de /

original: mdzub mo g-yas pa lcags kyur byas la bzhag pa ni rdo rje lcags kyu'i phyag rgya ste sngags la /
analyzed: mdzub mo g-yas pa lcags kyur byas la bzhag pa ni rdo rje lcags kyu'i phyag rgya ste sngags la /

original: aom badzra aam gu sha ma h'a kro dha a'a karsha ya sarba sa ma yam h'um dza:/
analyzed: aom badzra aam gu sha ma h'a kro dha a'a karsha ya sarba sa ma yam h'um dza:/
translated: oṃ vajra aṅkuśa mahā-krodha ākarṣaya sarva-samayaṃ hūṃ jaḥ

original: de nyid dang mdzub mo gnyis rtse sprad nas zhags pa dang 'dra bar bzhag pa ni rdo rje zhags pa'i phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: de nyid dang mdzub mo gnyis rtse sprad nas zhags pa dang 'dra bar bzhag pa ni rdo rje zhags pa'i phyag rgya ste /

original: sngags la aom badzra p'a sha ma h'a kro dha par be sha ya sarba sa ma ya h'um h'um /
analyzed: sngags la aom badzra p'a sha ma h'a kro dha par be sha ya sarba sa ma ya h'um h'um /
