original: de nyid las mdzub mo gnyis lu gu rgyud ltar mdud pa ni rdo rje lcags sgrig gi phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: de nyid las mdzub mo gnyis lu gu rgyud ltar mdud pa ni rdo rje lcags sgrig gi phyag rgya ste /
translated: The two index fingers are tied like a chain from that mudra, which is the mudra of the vajra fetters.

original: sngags la / aom badzra spho ta ma h'a kro dha bandha ya sarba sa ma ya h'um bam /
analyzed: sngags la / aom badzra spho ta ma h'a kro dha bandha ya sarba sa ma ya h'um bam /
translated: The mantra is: Oṃ vajra śphura mahā-krodha bandhaya sarva samaya hūṃ vaṃ.

original: de nas rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi phyag rgya bcing sa la de rnams kyi mgo la yi ge h'um bkod de /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi phyag rgya bcing sa la de rnams kyi mgo la yi ge h'um bkod de /
translated: Then, having bound the mudra of Vajra Hūṃkara, one should place the syllable hūṃ on their heads.

original: snga ma bzhin du rdo rje thur bu bskyed la /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du rdo rje thur bu bskyed la /
translated: As before, one should generate the vajra pick.

original: rkad  pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar phur bus gdab par bsams te /
analyzed: rkad  pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar phur bus gdab par bsams te /
translated: One should imagine that they are staked down with the stake up to the end of the recitation.

original: bka' bsgo ba'i tshul gyis sngags 'di brjod par bya'o//
analyzed: bka' bsgo ba'i tshul gyis sngags 'di brjod par bya'o//
translated: One should recite this mantra in the manner of giving a command:

original: aom badzra k'i li k'i la ya sarba bighnam bandha h'um phat /
analyzed: aom badzra k'i li k'i la ya sarba bighnam bandha h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ vajra kīli kīlaya sarva vighnān baṃdha hūṃ phaṭ.

original: de nas badzra k'i li k'i la ru ta ma ta /
analyzed: de nas badzra k'i li k'i la ru ta ma ta /
translated: Then, “vajra kilikī la ru ta ma ta.”🔽

original: zhes bya ba lan bdun bzlas pa'i yungs kar yi ge h'um 'bar pa lta bus brdeg par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba lan bdun bzlas pa'i yungs kar yi ge h'um 'bar pa lta bus brdeg par bya ste /
translated: Then, one should strike with mustard seed, which has been enchanted seven times with the mantra vajra kīlikīla kuru maṭa, as if with burning hūṃs.

original: chog 'di ni ji srid dkyil 'khor zhag gi bar du nyin te zhing nyi ma kung la bya'o //🔽pha rol gyi bgegso  @167a * //
analyzed: chog 'di ni ji srid dkyil 'khor zhag gi bar du nyin te zhing nyi ma kung la bya'o // pha rol gyi bgegso  @167a * //
translated: This rite should be performed as long as the mandala lasts, day and night, at the time of the sun and moon.

original: gzhom pa'i cho ga'o /
analyzed: gzhom pa'i cho ga'o /
translated: This is the rite for destroying the obstacles of others.

original: // / de nas yid dang rjes su mthun pa'i gnas su spos chu la sogs pas nye bar byugs shing me tog sil ma gtor la bdug spos dri zhim pos bdug pa dang / ci snyed pa'i mchod pa rnam pa lda dang ldan pa dag tu stan nang tshangs can 'jam pa la 'dug ste /
analyzed: // / de nas yid dang rjes su mthun pa'i gnas su spos chu la sogs pas nye bar byugs shing me tog sil ma gtor la bdug spos dri zhim pos bdug pa dang / ci snyed pa'i mchod pa rnam pa lda dang ldan pa dag tu stan nang tshangs can 'jam pa la 'dug ste /
translated: Then, in a place that is pleasing to the mind, one should anoint with perfumed water and so forth, scatter loose flowers, burn fragrant incense, and in a place endowed with all the various offerings, sit on a soft cushion with a lining.

original: sngags 'di dag gis sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: sngags 'di dag gis sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: With these mantras, one should confess misdeeds and so forth.

original: aom barba p'a pam ka po ka pi ka po ci ka man so bh'a tam r'a ga de sha mo ha m'a da man aa bhishthi na ya rkri tam tre k'a li kam / h'um h'um h'um h'um /
analyzed: aom barba p'a pam ka po ka pi ka po ci ka man so bh'a tam r'a ga de sha mo ha m'a da man aa bhishthi na ya rkri tam tre k'a li kam / h'um h'um h'um h'um /
translated: Hum hum hum hum.

original: phat phat phat phat /
analyzed: phat phat phat phat /
translated: Phaṭ phaṭ phaṭ phaṭ.

original: sarb p'a pa spo ta y'a mi sv'a h'a /
analyzed: sarb p'a pa spo ta y'a mi sv'a h'a /
translated: May all evil be removed. Svāhā.

original: aom sarba p'a pam pra ti de sha mi sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom sarba p'a pam pra ti de sha mi sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ, may all evil be confessed. Svāhā.

original: sarba ta th'a ga ta nam /
analyzed: sarba ta th'a ga ta nam /
translated: Homage to all the tathāgatas.

original: aa tma bha ba na ni ry'a ta y'a mi ;🔽sarba ta th'a ga ta pra ti krihnan tu mam sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aa tma bha ba na ni ry'a ta y'a mi ; sarba ta th'a ga ta pra ti krihnan tu mam sv'a h'a /
translated: May the power of the truth of the tathāgatas purify me.🔽May I be purified by the truth of all the tathāgatas. Svāhā.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta pu nye dznya na sam bha ram aa nu mo de y'a mi sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta pu nye dznya na sam bha ram aa nu mo de y'a mi sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ, may the power of the truth of the knowledge of the merit of all the tathāgatas purify me. Svāhā.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta sa manta bha dra ma h'a badzra sa ma ya ma h'a bo dhi tsi tto tp'a ta mutpa da ya mi sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta sa manta bha dra ma h'a badzra sa ma ya ma h'a bo dhi tsi tto tp'a ta mutpa da ya mi sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ, may the power of the truth of the great vajra vow of the great bodhicitta of all the tathāgatas generate the supreme mind of awakening. Svāhā.

original: de nas aom sarba ta tha'a ga ta shvan si ta sarba sa ta dh'a nam /
analyzed: de nas aom sarba ta tha'a ga ta shvan si ta sarba sa ta dh'a nam /
translated: Then, oṃ, all the tathāgatas, all the lords, all the beings,

original: sarba siddha ya sam pa na dyan tam sarba ta th'a ga ta shtsa aadhi shtha n'a tam /
analyzed: sarba siddha ya sam pa na dyan tam sarba ta th'a ga ta shtsa aadhi shtha n'a tam /
translated: Sarvasiddhaya sampannakaraṇāya tam sarvatathāgatādhiṣṭhānātma.🔽

original: sva bh'a ba shuddha: sarba dha rm'a:sv'a bh'a ba shu ddho& ham /
analyzed: sva bh'a ba shuddha: sarba dha rm'a:sv'a bh'a ba shu ddho& ham /
translated: sarvasiddhaya samayantamaḥ sarvatathāgatādhīṣṭanātamaḥ🔽svabhāvaśuddhaḥ sarvadharmāḥ svabhāvaśuddho’ham.

original: zhes bya bas phyi deng nang gi chos thams cad gzod ma nas ma skyes pa rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa nam mkha' dang mnyam par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bas phyi deng nang gi chos thams cad gzod ma nas ma skyes pa rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa nam mkha' dang mnyam par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should meditate on all external and internal phenomena as primordially unborn, naturally pure, and equal to space.🔽Then, in the center of the sky of the mind of meditation, which is the accumulation of merit and wisdom, one should visualize a great lotus and moon mandala with a vast network of light.

original: de nas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis bsgom pa'i sems nyid nam mkha'i ngos kyi dbus su chud pa 'od kyi dra ba chen po dang ldan pa'i padma dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor du gyur pa la de'i steng du shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid🔽can gyi yi ge mu kha dog dmar skya /
analyzed: de nas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis bsgom pa'i sems nyid nam mkha'i ngos kyi dbus su chud pa 'od kyi dra ba chen po dang ldan pa'i padma dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor du gyur pa la de'i steng du shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid can gyi yi ge mu kha dog dmar skya /
translated: Upon that, one should visualize the syllable muṃ, which is the nature of wisdom and method,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dpag tu med pa'i 'od zer 'phro ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dpag tu med pa'i 'od zer 'phro ba'o //
translated: red in color, and radiating immeasurable light rays of the tathāgatas.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las rje btsun 'jam dpal zla ba lta bu'i sku dang ldan pa /
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las rje btsun 'jam dpal zla ba lta bu'i sku dang ldan pa /
translated: That completely transforms into Venerable Mañjuśrī, who has a body like the moon.

original: padma dang zla ba'i steng du rdo rje skyil mo krung gis bzhugs pa //
analyzed: padma dang zla ba'i steng du rdo rje skyil mo krung gis bzhugs pa //
translated: He sits in vajra posture upon a lotus and moon.

original: phyag g-yas gnyis na ral gri dang / mda' bsnams pa /
analyzed: phyag g-yas gnyis na ral gri dang / mda' bsnams pa /
translated: In his two right hands he holds a sword and an arrow.

original: phyag g-yon gnyis na shes rab kyi pha rol du phyin pa'i glegs bam dang gzhu bsnams pa nyid de /
analyzed: phyag g-yon gnyis na shes rab kyi pha rol du phyin pa'i glegs bam dang gzhu bsnams pa nyid de /
translated: In his two left hands he holds a volume of the Perfection of Wisdom and a bow.

original: shes rab ral gri mda' gzhu thogs //
analyzed: shes rab ral gri mda' gzhu thogs //
translated: He holds a sword, arrow, and bow of wisdom.

original: zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ste /
translated: He is described in the following lines:

original: sangs rgyas lda'i cod pan can mnga' ba //
analyzed: sangs rgyas lda'i cod pan can mnga' ba //
translated: He has a crown with the Buddhas and

original: byis pa'i rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: byis pa'i rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /
translated: is adorned with all the ornaments of a youth.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang / khro bo dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / rig pa'i lha mo thams cad spro ba dang / bsdu ba'i bdag nyid can du bdag nyid @167b rnam par bsams la //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang / khro bo dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / rig pa'i lha mo thams cad spro ba dang / bsdu ba'i bdag nyid can du bdag nyid @167b rnam par bsams la //
translated: Imagine that you emanate and reabsorb all the tathāgatas, wrathful ones, bodhisattvas, and knowledge goddesses.

original: snying ga dang smin mtshams dang / lkog ma dang spyi bo rnams su rdo rje dang rin po che dang / padma dang sna tshogs rdo rje dag la rdo rje sems ma dang / rin chen sems ma dang / chos kyi sems ma dang / las kyi sems ma'i ngo bo nyid de //
analyzed: snying ga dang smin mtshams dang / lkog ma dang spyi bo rnams su rdo rje dang rin po che dang / padma dang sna tshogs rdo rje dag la rdo rje sems ma dang / rin chen sems ma dang / chos kyi sems ma dang / las kyi sems ma'i ngo bo nyid de //
translated: At the heart, the brow, the throat, and the crown of the head, there are vajras, jewels, lotuses, and crossed vajras, which are the essences of Vajrasattva, Ratnasattva, Dharmasattva, and Karma- sattva.

original: phyag rgya bzhis rgyas btab par bdag nyid rnam par bsams la //🔽sa ma ya stvam ham /
analyzed: phyag rgya bzhis rgyas btab par bdag nyid rnam par bsams la // sa ma ya stvam ham /
translated: One should visualize oneself as being sealed with the four seals.

original: zhes brjod do //
analyzed: zhes brjod do //
translated: One should recite: “Samayasattva ham.”

original: de nas mdun du yi ge hr'i: las padma aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bskyed la ye shes sems dpa' rdo rje lcags kyu la sogs pas bkug la bcings te /
analyzed: de nas mdun du yi ge hr'i: las padma aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bskyed la ye shes sems dpa' rdo rje lcags kyu la sogs pas bkug la bcings te /
translated: Then, in front of oneself, one should generate a lotus from the syllable hrīḥ and a moon maṇḍala from the syllable a. One should summon the gnosis being Vajraṅkuśa and the others, bind them,

original: dbang du bya ba nas mchod yon dang zhabs bsil dang / me tog dang / spos dang / mar me dang / dri la sogs pas yang dag par mchod la /
analyzed: dbang du bya ba nas mchod yon dang zhabs bsil dang / me tog dang / spos dang / mar me dang / dri la sogs pas yang dag par mchod la /
translated: and control them. One should make offerings with water for the feet, water for the mouth, flowers, incense, lamps, perfume, and so forth.

original: lta ba nyid du byas nas de bzhin du mchod cing dbang bskur la rang gi lus la gzhug par bya ste /
analyzed: lta ba nyid du byas nas de bzhin du mchod cing dbang bskur la rang gi lus la gzhug par bya ste /
translated: Having made it into the view, in the same way, worship it, confer initiation, and cause it to enter your body.

original: ye shes sems dpa' de bltas nas rang gi lus la rnam par bsgom zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //🔽de nas gcig tu gyur pas rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang pos brgyan pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la sogs pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo sprul par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dbang bskur bas dbang bskur bar bdag nyid shes nas rdo rje nas rdo rje 'khor
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa' de bltas nas rang gi lus la rnam par bsgom zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro // de nas gcig tu gyur pas rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang pos brgyan pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la sogs pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo sprul par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dbang bskur bas dbang bskur bar bdag nyid shes nas rdo rje nas rdo rje 'khor
translated: Having seen the wisdom-being, meditate on it in your body.🔽Then, having become one, with all the best aspects, adorned with the thirty-two marks and the eighty excellent signs, you should know that you are empowered by the empowerment of all the buddhas, in order to emanate the supramundane mandala circle of all the tathāgatas, and so forth.

original: lo'i phyag rgya bcings la /
analyzed: lo'i phyag rgya bcings la /
translated: Having bound the vajra-wheel gesture with the vajra,

original: gan rkyal du khar bzhag ste /
analyzed: gan rkyal du khar bzhag ste /
translated: place it on your lap,

original: thams cad bskor la sngags 'di lan bdun bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad bskor la sngags 'di lan bdun bzlas par bya'o //
translated: and having turned it all around, repeat this mantra seven times.

original: aom badzra tsa kra h'um phyag rgya ni rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings la /
analyzed: aom badzra tsa kra h'um phyag rgya ni rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings la /
translated: The mudra is to form the two vajra fists,

original: mdzub mo dang mthe'u chung gnyis lu gu rgyud ltar byas pa ni rdo rje 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: mdzub mo dang mthe'u chung gnyis lu gu rgyud ltar byas pa ni rdo rje 'khor lo'o //
translated: and interlock the index and small fingers like a chain.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo ma lus pa mngon sum bzhin du yang dag par bltas la /
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo ma lus pa mngon sum bzhin du yang dag par bltas la /
translated: Then, having seen the entire maṇḍala wheel as if in actuality,

original: 'og nas bshad pa'i mchod pa'i khyad par rnams kyis legs par mchod de /
analyzed: 'og nas bshad pa'i mchod pa'i khyad par rnams kyis legs par mchod de /
translated: one should make offerings with the special offerings explained below.

original: rje btsun gyi mtshan yang dag par brjod pa thun bzhi'i rim gyis ji srid du mthong bar gyur pa de srid du bzla bar bya ba'am //
analyzed: rje btsun gyi mtshan yang dag par brjod pa thun bzhi'i rim gyis ji srid du mthong bar gyur pa de srid du bzla bar bya ba'am //
translated: Recite the Praise to the Names of the Exalted One in four sessions until one sees the Exalted One.

original: mtshan ma byung ba'am /
analyzed: mtshan ma byung ba'am /
translated: Or, until the signs arise,

original: dkyil 'khor bri ba'i phyir rmi lam mthong gi bar du /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bri ba'i phyir rmi lam mthong gi bar du /
translated: or until one sees the maṇḍala in a dream for the sake of drawing the maṇḍala.

original: aom badzra t'i kashna zhes bya ba la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: aom badzra t'i kashna zhes bya ba la sogs pa'am /
translated: Recite the mantra oṃ vajra-tīkṣṇa and so forth,

original: gsang sngags gzhan dag bzla ba'am /🔽rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa spro ba dang @168a * //
analyzed: gsang sngags gzhan dag bzla ba'am /🔽rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa spro ba dang @168a * //
translated: or recite other secret mantras,🔽or visualize the maṇḍala of the deities of the maṇḍala in the sky in front.

original: bsdu ba'i bdag nyid can skad cig ma'i ye shes las byung ba'i rje btsun 'jam dpal du bdag nyid bsams la /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i bdag nyid can skad cig ma'i ye shes las byung ba'i rje btsun 'jam dpal du bdag nyid bsams la /
translated: Having visualized oneself as the noble Mañjuśrī, who is the embodiment of the collections, arisen from the wisdom of the moment,

original: dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid sems tsam gyi sprul pa khong du chud pas sems kyi sprul pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo yang dag par bltas la ji srid mtshan ma byung bar gyur pa de srid kyi bar du mtshan yang dag par brjod pa bklag
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid sems tsam gyi sprul pa khong du chud pas sems kyi sprul pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo yang dag par bltas la ji srid mtshan ma byung bar gyur pa de srid kyi bar du mtshan yang dag par brjod pa bklag
translated: one should recite the Praise in Verse of the Exalted One for as long as the signs arise, having contemplated the maṇḍala wheel of the emanations of the mind, having understood that the nature of all things is the emanation of mere mind.

original: par bya'o // sngon du bsnyen pa'i cho ga mdor bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: par bya'o // sngon du bsnyen pa'i cho ga mdor bsdus pa'o //
translated: This is the concise ritual of the preliminary service.

original: de'i 'og tu nyin re'am /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu nyin re'am /
translated: Then, every day

original: zla ba re 'am /
analyzed: zla ba re 'am /
translated: or every month

original: lo te nyid du ji ltar mngon par dga' bar bsgrub cing zla ba yar gyi do la cho ga bzhin du dkyil 'khor bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: lo te nyid du ji ltar mngon par dga' bar bsgrub cing zla ba yar gyi do la cho ga bzhin du dkyil 'khor bri bar bya'o //
translated: or every year, one should practice as much as one likes, and on the full moon one should draw the maṇḍala according to the rite.

original: de la rgyal pos ni khru brgya 'am /
analyzed: de la rgyal pos ni khru brgya 'am /
translated: There, the king should draw it one hundred cubits

original: khru lnga bcu'o //
analyzed: khru lnga bcu'o //
translated: or fifty cubits.

original: blon po 'am blon po chen po rnams kyis ni khru lnga bcu 'am /
analyzed: blon po 'am blon po chen po rnams kyis ni khru lnga bcu 'am /
translated: The ministers or the chief ministers should draw it fifty cubits

original: nyi shu rtsa lnga'o //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa lnga'o //
translated: or twenty-five cubits.

original: ded dpon nam //
analyzed: ded dpon nam //
translated: the captain,

original: tshong dpon chen po rnams kyis ni ni shu rtsa lnga'am /
analyzed: tshong dpon chen po rnams kyis ni ni shu rtsa lnga'am /
translated: or the great merchant, [it should be] twenty-five cubits,

original: de'i phyed do //
analyzed: de'i phyed do //
translated: or half that.

original: sgrub pa po rnams kyis ni khru bcu gnyis sam /
analyzed: sgrub pa po rnams kyis ni khru bcu gnyis sam /
translated: For the adepts, [it should be] twelve cubits,

original: khru drug pa'am /
analyzed: khru drug pa'am /
translated: or six cubits,

original: ci nus par bya'o//
analyzed: ci nus par bya'o//
translated: or whatever is possible.

original: de la dang por re zhig yo byad thams cad yang dag par ldan pas mngon par 'dod pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi sa'i dbus su mi rus kyi phye ma'i sbyin sreg gis dkyil 'khor gyi bgegs mngon par bsal la /
analyzed: de la dang por re zhig yo byad thams cad yang dag par ldan pas mngon par 'dod pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi sa'i dbus su mi rus kyi phye ma'i sbyin sreg gis dkyil 'khor gyi bgegs mngon par bsal la /
translated: There, first of all, having gathered together all the requisites, in the center of the maṇḍala ground that is desired, one should completely remove the maṇḍala obstructors with a burnt offering of human bone ash.

original: bdag dang slob ma la sogs pas zhi ba'i sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: bdag dang slob ma la sogs pas zhi ba'i sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: One should perform a burnt offering for peace for oneself, the disciples, and so forth.

original: de nas sa spyad bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas sa spyad bar bya ste /
translated: Then, one should examine the ground.

original: 'dom gang tsam mam khru gang tsam 'og tu brkos la dri zhi ma po'i chus gtor ba'i sas slar bkang la /
analyzed: 'dom gang tsam mam khru gang tsam 'og tu brkos la dri zhi ma po'i chus gtor ba'i sas slar bkang la /
translated: Having dug one cubit or one fathom below, one should fill it back in with the same earth that was dug up, moistened with water that is not the remains of use,

original: rdo rje rtse mos mngon par bsngags pa'i spos chus chag chag btab ste /
analyzed: rdo rje rtse mos mngon par bsngags pa'i spos chus chag chag btab ste /
translated: and sprinkle it with perfumed water, incanting it with the vajra-tipped mantra.

original: kun du brdungs la shin tu mnyam pa khang pa brtsegs pa'i nang du chud pa rta babs bzhis mdzes par byas la /
analyzed: kun du brdungs la shin tu mnyam pa khang pa brtsegs pa'i nang du chud pa rta babs bzhis mdzes par byas la /
translated: Having beaten it well, it should be very even, and placed inside a pavilion, beautified with four porticos.

original: sgo bzhi dang skar khung dra ba can la sogs pas yongs su bskor ba la mtha' ma rnams su legs par bris shing dril bu btags pa'i rgyal mtshan bzang po gzugs pa dang / bla re dam pa bri ba dang / sangs rgyas rin po che la sogs pa'i ras ris kyis nye bar mdzes par byas pa ba'i lci bas dang dag par sbyangs shing dros nye bar byugs pa dang /
analyzed: sgo bzhi dang skar khung dra ba can la sogs pas yongs su bskor ba la mtha' ma rnams su legs par bris shing dril bu btags pa'i rgyal mtshan bzang po gzugs pa dang / bla re dam pa bri ba dang / sangs rgyas rin po che la sogs pa'i ras ris kyis nye bar mdzes par byas pa ba'i lci bas dang dag par sbyangs shing dros nye bar byugs pa dang /
translated: It should be surrounded with four doors and windows with latticework, and so forth, and at the edges, excellent banners should be erected, well-drawn and with bells attached, and a fine canopy should be spread.🔽Having purified it with white clay and anointed it with perfume,

original: mtshams bzhir spos khang bzhag pa dang / me tog dang gos la sogs pas nye bar mdzes par byas la //
analyzed: mtshams bzhir spos khang bzhag pa dang / me tog dang gos la sogs pas nye bar mdzes par byas la //
translated: and placed incense burners in the four directions, and having beautified it with flowers, cloth, and so forth,

original: lag pa sa la bzhag se /
analyzed: lag pa sa la bzhag se /
translated: one should place one's hands on the ground

original: h'um bzhi pa dang / yi ge brgya pa lan bdun yongs su bzlas par @168b bya'o //
analyzed: h'um bzhi pa dang / yi ge brgya pa lan bdun yongs su bzlas par @168b bya'o //
translated: and recite the four-syllable [mantra] and the hundred-syllable [mantra] seven times.

original: de nas khrus byas shing dris byugs la gos dmar po'i stod g-yogs dang / ze'u ka bcings la me tog gi phreng ba gdags shing gdong dri zhim pos byugs la gdu bu dang / rna rgyan la sogs pas bdag nyid legs par brgyan te /
analyzed: de nas khrus byas shing dris byugs la gos dmar po'i stod g-yogs dang / ze'u ka bcings la me tog gi phreng ba gdags shing gdong dri zhim pos byugs la gdu bu dang / rna rgyan la sogs pas bdag nyid legs par brgyan te /
translated: having tied up one's hair, wearing a garland of flowers, having anointed one's face with sweet smelling substances, having well adorned oneself with bracelets, earrings, and so on,

original: zla ba nya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: zla ba nya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: beginning from the full moon,

original: phyi ma'i nya'i bar du dkyil 'khor gyi las byas pa'am //
analyzed: phyi ma'i nya'i bar du dkyil 'khor gyi las byas pa'am //
translated: one should perform the mandala rite up to the next full moon.

original: yar gyi ngo la tshes gcig nas brtsams pa'am //
analyzed: yar gyi ngo la tshes gcig nas brtsams pa'am //
translated: Or, beginning from the first day of the waxing moon,

original: de bzhin nyid tshes brgyad dang / tshes dgu dang / tshes bcu gsum dang tshes bcu bzhi rnams la brtsams nas nya'i bar du'am /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid tshes brgyad dang / tshes dgu dang / tshes bcu gsum dang tshes bcu bzhi rnams la brtsams nas nya'i bar du'am /
translated: or likewise on the eighth, ninth, thirteenth, or fourteenth day, one should perform [the rite] up to the full moon.

original: snga dro'i dus su brtsams nas bya'o //
analyzed: snga dro'i dus su brtsams nas bya'o //
translated: Or, one should perform [the rite] beginning from the morning.

original: de la dang por dkyil 'khor gyi sa'i dbus su 'dug la bgegs bsal ba la sogs pa bya ste /
analyzed: de la dang por dkyil 'khor gyi sa'i dbus su 'dug la bgegs bsal ba la sogs pa bya ste /
translated: There, first, sitting in the middle of the mandala site, one should perform the repelling of obstacles and so on.

original: sems dpa'i skyil mo krung du 'dug nas /
analyzed: sems dpa'i skyil mo krung du 'dug nas /
translated: Sitting in the sattva posture,

original: de nyid kyis na rdo rje gzung //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na rdo rje gzung //
translated: one should hold the vajra with just that [hand].

original: chos kyi dril bu dkrol bar bya //
analyzed: chos kyi dril bu dkrol bar bya //
translated: One should ring the dharma bell.

original: dam tshig gi ni phyag rgya cher //
analyzed: dam tshig gi ni phyag rgya cher //
translated: The great seal of sacred commitment

original: byin gyis brlabs nas snying po bzla //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs nas snying po bzla //
translated: is consecrated, and the essence mantra is recited.

original: de ltar mchog tu dam tshig gsum thob pa'i slob dpon gyis rang gi phyag rgyas rdo rje dang dril bu bzung la //
analyzed: de ltar mchog tu dam tshig gsum thob pa'i slob dpon gyis rang gi phyag rgyas rdo rje dang dril bu bzung la //
translated: Thus, the master who has obtained the three sacred commitments of the supreme should hold the vajra and bell with his own seal.

original: sems can thams cad la phan pa'i cho ga'i bya ba byas te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan pa'i cho ga'i bya ba byas te /
translated: Having performed the ritual actions for the benefit of all sentient beings,🔽one should enter all the mandalas

original: rtog pa kun la yang dag 'jug / dkyil 'khor thams cad bsgrub pa ni //
analyzed: rtog pa kun la yang dag 'jug / dkyil 'khor thams cad bsgrub pa ni //
translated: and accomplish all the mandalas.

original: dam tshig chen po gsum zhes bya //
analyzed: dam tshig chen po gsum zhes bya //
translated: This is called the three great sacred commitments.

original: rgya 'di gsang sngags bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: rgya 'di gsang sngags bsgrub pa'o //
translated: This seal is the accomplishment of secret mantra.

original: dngos grub cho ga thams cad la //
analyzed: dngos grub cho ga thams cad la //
translated: In all the rituals for the accomplishment of spiritual powers,

original: rdo rje dril bu rab bskul bas //
analyzed: rdo rje dril bu rab bskul bas //
translated: the vajra and bell are fully activated.

original: cho ga lhag gam ma tshang yang //
analyzed: cho ga lhag gam ma tshang yang //
translated: Even if the ritual is incomplete or deficient,

original: 'grub 'gyur smad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'grub 'gyur smad par mi bya'o //
translated: it will be accomplished without disparaging it.

original: de yang dang po sa'i lha mo yi ge pam las byung ba lag na bum pa thogs pa rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa bsams la //
analyzed: de yang dang po sa'i lha mo yi ge pam las byung ba lag na bum pa thogs pa rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa bsams la //
translated: Furthermore, first one should visualize the earth goddess arising from the syllable pam, holding a vase in her hand, adorned with all ornaments,

original: 'dod pa'i rgyal pos bkug ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rgyal pos bkug ste /
translated: and summon her with the king of desire.

original: me tog la sogs pas mchod nas gsol ba gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: me tog la sogs pas mchod nas gsol ba gdab par bya'o //
translated: Having made offerings with flowers and so forth, one should make a supplication.

original: de la phyag rgya dang sngags 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la phyag rgya dang sngags 'di yin te /
translated: The mudra and mantra for that are as follows:

original: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis rgyab sbyar la mdzub mo dang / mthe'u chung gnyis mdud pa bya ba ni 'dod pa'i rgyal po'i phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis rgyab sbyar la mdzub mo dang / mthe'u chung gnyis mdud pa bya ba ni 'dod pa'i rgyal po'i phyag rgya ste /
translated: The mudra of the king of desire is to join the two vajra fists behind the back, and to make a knot with the two index fingers and two pinky fingers.

original: sngags la takki h'um dza /
analyzed: sngags la takki h'um dza /
translated: The mantra is takki hūṃ ja.

original: de nas 'di skad brjod do //
analyzed: de nas 'di skad brjod do //
translated: Then one should say this:🔽“Goddess, you are the witness🔽of the distinctive modes of conduct

original: skyob pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyi //
analyzed: skyob pa sangs rgyas thams cad kyi //
translated: of all the buddhas, the protectors,

original: spyod pa'i tshul gyi khyad par dang // sa dang pha rol phyin pa la //🔽lha mo khyod ni dpang du gyur //🔽sh'a kya seng ge skyob pa yis //
analyzed: spyod pa'i tshul gyi khyad par dang // sa dang pha rol phyin pa la // lha mo khyod ni dpang du gyur // sh'a kya seng ge skyob pa yis //
translated: and of the levels and perfections.🔽Just as the protector, the lion of the Śākyas,

original: ji ltar bdud kyi sde bcom pa //
analyzed: ji ltar bdud kyi sde bcom pa //
translated: destroyed the hosts of Māra,

original: de bzhin bdag gis bdud kyi sde //
analyzed: de bzhin bdag gis bdud kyi sde //
translated: in the same way, I will destroy

original: bcom par byas te dkyil 'khor @169a * //
analyzed: bcom par byas te dkyil 'khor @169a * //
translated: the hosts of Māra and draw the maṇḍala.”

original: bri ; / zhes lan gsum brjod do //
analyzed: bri ; / zhes lan gsum brjod do //
translated: Say that three times.

original: de nas de nyid du thim par gyur par bsams la /
analyzed: de nas de nyid du thim par gyur par bsams la /
translated: Then imagine that [the goddess] dissolves into that [vajra].

original: de'i steng du rdo rje bcing ga ba thur du bstan te bcings la bzhag ste /
analyzed: de'i steng du rdo rje bcing ga ba thur du bstan te bcings la bzhag ste /
translated: Place the vajra bond above that, facing down, and bind it.

original: aom badzr'i bha ba h'um /
analyzed: aom badzr'i bha ba h'um /
translated: Oṃ vajra-bhāva hūṃ.

original: zhes lan gsum brjod do //
analyzed: zhes lan gsum brjod do //
translated: One should recite this three times.

original: de nas rdo rje bcing ba las byung ba'i hum 'bar ba'i tshogs kyi sa gzhi gtan pa la thug gi bar du rdo rjer gyur par rnam par bsams la 'di skad do //
analyzed: de nas rdo rje bcing ba las byung ba'i hum 'bar ba'i tshogs kyi sa gzhi gtan pa la thug gi bar du rdo rjer gyur par rnam par bsams la 'di skad do //
translated: Then, from the vajra-bond, one should imagine that the ground becomes a vajra, blazing with hūṃs, down to the very foundation of space.

original: dri dha badzra ti shatha /
analyzed: dri dha badzra ti shatha /
translated: Dṛdhā vajrī tiṣṭha.

original: de nas dang po'i sbyor ba dang dkyil 'khor gyi rgyal mchog dang las kyi rgyal mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gsum bsgom par bya ste /🔽bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa'i bdag nyid can //
analyzed: de nas dang po'i sbyor ba dang dkyil 'khor gyi rgyal mchog dang las kyi rgyal mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gsum bsgom par bya ste / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa'i bdag nyid can //
translated: Then one should cultivate the three samādhis called the initial union, the supreme royal maṇḍala, and the supreme royal activity.🔽One should imagine oneself as a great bodhisattva, the embodiment of the perfection of merit and wisdom,

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i gzugs su 'og min gyi gzhal yas khang na gnas nas mngon par byang chub mngon sum du byed cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i gzugs su 'og min gyi gzhal yas khang na gnas nas mngon par byang chub mngon sum du byed cing /
translated: dwelling in the Akaniṣṭha palace, actualizing complete enlightenment,

original: mi g-yo ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par bzhugs par rim pa 'dis bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par bzhugs par rim pa 'dis bsam par bya ste /
translated: and resting in the immovable samādhi, in this sequence.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ces bya ba'am //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ces bya ba'am //
translated: One should imagine oneself as a great bodhisattva, the embodiment of the perfection of merit and wisdom,🔽dwelling in the Akaniṣṭha palace, actualizing complete enlightenment,🔽and resting in the immovable samādhi, in this sequence.

original: phyin ci ma log par yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub pa'i man ngag sbyin par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad yang dag par 'dus par gyur nas //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log par yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub pa'i man ngag sbyin par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad yang dag par 'dus par gyur nas //
translated: In order to give the instructions for the perfect, complete enlightenment that is not mistaken, all the tathāgatas gathered together.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po don zhes bya ba byang chub kyi snying por bzhugs pa gang na bder gshegs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po don zhes bya ba byang chub kyi snying por bzhugs pa gang na bder gshegs te /
translated: They went to where the bodhisattva mahāsattva named Amogha was sitting at the seat of awakening.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de la ched du bya ba rdzogs pa longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku bstan nas 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de la ched du bya ba rdzogs pa longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku bstan nas 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: They revealed to that bodhisattva the saṃbhogakāya, which is the perfection of the purpose, and said this:

original: rigs kyi bu khyod kyis gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid ma rtogs par bka' ba spyad pa thams cad la spro ba bskyed cing //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod kyis gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi de kho na nyid ma rtogs par bka' ba spyad pa thams cad la spro ba bskyed cing //
translated: “Son of family, you have generated enthusiasm for all the practices of the bodhisattva conduct without realizing the thatness of all the tathāgatas.

original: ji ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par bya snyam zhes gsung shing gan du byon te /
analyzed: ji ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par bya snyam zhes gsung shing gan du byon te /
translated: How will you fully, completely awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment?”

original: badzrod tishtha zhes bya ba'i sngags dang / se go la brdabs pas slong bar mdzad par bsam mo //
analyzed: badzrod tishtha zhes bya ba'i sngags dang / se go la brdabs pas slong bar mdzad par bsam mo //
translated: With the mantra vajrodaka and the sound of snapping one's fingers, one should imagine that they are aroused.

original: de nas langs nas mchog tu dad pas //
analyzed: de nas langs nas mchog tu dad pas //
translated: Then, having arisen, with supreme faith,

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta k'a ya b'a ka tsi tta badzra pra na mya na badzra bandha nam ka ro mi zhes brjod la phag byas nas 'di skad ces gsol te //
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta k'a ya b'a ka tsi tta badzra pra na mya na badzra bandha nam ka ro mi zhes brjod la phag byas nas 'di skad ces gsol te //
translated: one should make obeisance with the mantra Om sarva tathāgata kāya vāk citta vajra pranamya namaḥ vajra bandha namaskāra muḥ and say this:

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bdag gis ma 'tshal na de kho na nyid ji lta bu lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bdag gis ma 'tshal na de kho na nyid ji lta bu lags /
translated: Bhagavat, if I do not know all the tathāgatas, what is that reality?

original: de ltar na bsgrub par bgyi //
analyzed: de ltar na bsgrub par bgyi //
translated: In that way, I will accomplish it.

original: bka' @169b stsal du gsol //
analyzed: bka' @169b stsal du gsol //
translated: Please command it.

original: de nas rigs kyi bu rang gi sems la so sor rtog cing mnyam par zhog la /
analyzed: de nas rigs kyi bu rang gi sems la so sor rtog cing mnyam par zhog la /
translated: Then, son of good family, examine your own mind and rest in equipoise.

original: rang bzhin gyis grub pa'i sngags 'di ci dgar bzlas shing bsgrub par gyis shig / ces gsung zhing sems so sor rtogs pa'i man dag de stsol bar bsam par bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis grub pa'i sngags 'di ci dgar bzlas shing bsgrub par gyis shig / ces gsung zhing sems so sor rtogs pa'i man dag de stsol bar bsam par bya ba ni /
translated: Recite this naturally established mantra as much as you like and accomplish it.

original: aom tsi tta pra ti be dham ka ro mi zhes bya ba phung po dang / khams dang skye mched dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba //
analyzed: aom tsi tta pra ti be dham ka ro mi zhes bya ba phung po dang / khams dang skye mched dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba //
translated: Free from conceptual thoughts such as aggregates, elements, sense bases, and subject and object,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang gnyis su med pa de kho na nyid kyi ngo bo nyid rtogs pa de'i bdag nyid kyi sems so sor rtogs pa dang / sems kyi rin po che de nyid snying rje chen pos brgyan pa //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang gnyis su med pa de kho na nyid kyi ngo bo nyid rtogs pa de'i bdag nyid kyi sems so sor rtogs pa dang / sems kyi rin po che de nyid snying rje chen pos brgyan pa //
translated: realizing the nature of non-duality with all the Tathāgatas, the mind that is of the nature of that [realization], the individually realized mind, and that very precious mind adorned with great compassion,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang mnyam pa'i mtshan nyid can //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang mnyam pa'i mtshan nyid can //
translated: having the characteristic of equality with all the Tathāgatas,

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor lta bu rang gi snying gar bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor lta bu rang gi snying gar bsgom par bya'o //
translated: like a moon disc, one should meditate on it in one's heart.

original: de nas 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then he said this:

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bdag gi snying ga na zla ba'i dkyil 'khor lta bur gda' ba bdag gis rtogs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad bdag gi snying ga na zla ba'i dkyil 'khor lta bur gda' ba bdag gis rtogs so //
translated: Blessed One, I realize that all the Tathāgatas appear in my heart like a moon disc.

original: de nas rigs kyi bu sems de ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bas na /
analyzed: de nas rigs kyi bu sems de ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bas na /
translated: Then, son of noble family, since that mind is naturally luminous,

original: de lta bur sbyangs pa de ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bur sbyangs pa de ltar 'gyur te /
translated: it becomes like that through such training.

original: dper na ras dkar po la tshon gyis bsgyur ba bzhin no zhes bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: dper na ras dkar po la tshon gyis bsgyur ba bzhin no zhes bka' stsal nas /
translated: It is like a white cloth being dyed.

original: slar yang byang chub kyi sems kyi man ngag ston par mdzad par bsam pa ni /
analyzed: slar yang byang chub kyi sems kyi man ngag ston par mdzad par bsam pa ni /
translated: After saying this, imagine that he again teaches the esoteric instructions on bodhicitta:

original: aom bo shi tsi tta autpa'a da 'a mi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: aom bo shi tsi tta autpa'a da 'a mi zhes bya'o //
translated: Oṃ. The mind is the flower of awakening.

original: de nas shin tu 'od gsal ba'i sems zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par yongs su gyur pa las //
analyzed: de nas shin tu 'od gsal ba'i sems zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par yongs su gyur pa las //
translated: Then, from the mind of utter luminosity, which has become the form of a moon disc,

original: rim gyis nye bar 'phel bar 'gyur ba dang / zla ba'i dkyil 'khor yongs su rdzogs par gyur to //
analyzed: rim gyis nye bar 'phel bar 'gyur ba dang / zla ba'i dkyil 'khor yongs su rdzogs par gyur to //
translated: it gradually increases and becomes a complete moon disc.

original: de nas 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then, imagine that you make the following request:

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor lta bur mthong ba gad lags pa de ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor nyid du mthong zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor lta bur mthong ba gad lags pa de ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor nyid du mthong zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “That which is seen as a moon disc is seen as the moon disc itself.”

original: shin tu rnam par dag cing nam mkha' ltar dri ma med pa la spros pa thams cad par bral ba me long lta bur rnam par gnas so //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag cing nam mkha' ltar dri ma med pa la spros pa thams cad par bral ba me long lta bur rnam par gnas so //
translated: It is extremely pure, stainless like space, and free from all conceptual elaborations, abiding like a mirror.

original: aom dznya' na shashmi pri si dza h'um zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis rnam par spros te /
analyzed: aom dznya' na shashmi pri si dza h'um zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis rnam par spros te /
translated: Having emanated with the mantra Om jnana shashi prasida hum,

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gang ba las 'od zer rnam pa sna tshogs par gang zhing byung ste /
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gang ba las 'od zer rnam pa sna tshogs par gang zhing byung ste /
translated: the moon mandala is filled with various kinds of light rays.🔽Having entered the immeasurable palace of the dharmadhatu,

original: byung ba de rnams chos kyi dbyings kyi gzhal yas khang du zhugs nas zhes bya'i dkyil 'khor thams cad @170a * //
analyzed: byung ba de rnams chos kyi dbyings kyi gzhal yas khang du zhugs nas zhes bya'i dkyil 'khor thams cad @170a * //
translated: all the mandalas

original: snang bar bya ste /
analyzed: snang bar bya ste /
translated: are illuminated.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi ri bo'i rtse mo bcom ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi ri bo'i rtse mo bcom ste /
translated: Having destroyed the peak of the mountain of the minds of all sentient beings,

original: rtogs par byas nas rdo rje chen po'i gzugs gcig tu gyur nas byung ste /
analyzed: rtogs par byas nas rdo rje chen po'i gzugs gcig tu gyur nas byung ste /
translated: having realized [the nature of phenomena], the great vajra form arises as one.

original: rtse lda pa spyi bo nas thugs kar bzhugs te /
analyzed: rtse lda pa spyi bo nas thugs kar bzhugs te /
translated: Having arisen from the crown to the heart,

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la rab tu gnas so //
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la rab tu gnas so //
translated: it abides in the moon mandala.

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi snying po sems bskyed pa kun du bzang po khyod kyis mngon sum du gyur gyis de legs par sgrubs shig / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis sems bskyed pa kun du bzang po de bstan par bya ba'i phyir
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi snying po sems bskyed pa kun du bzang po khyod kyis mngon sum du gyur gyis de legs par sgrubs shig / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis sems bskyed pa kun du bzang po de bstan par bya ba'i phyir
translated: In order to demonstrate the generation of the mind of Samantabhadra of all the Tathāgatas,

original: // sngags 'dis rang gi snying ga'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la rdo rje'i dbyibs su soms shig / aom tishtha badzra /
analyzed: // sngags 'dis rang gi snying ga'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la rdo rje'i dbyibs su soms shig / aom tishtha badzra /
translated: with this mantra, imagine the vajra shape on the moon disc in your heart: Oṃ tiṣṭha vajra.

original: yang sngags 'dis spro bar bya'o //🔽aom sphar badzra /
analyzed: yang sngags 'dis spro bar bya'o // aom sphar badzra /
translated: Again, with this mantra, one should emanate:🔽Oṃ spharaṇa vajra.

original: aom sam ha ra badzra /
analyzed: aom sam ha ra badzra /
translated: Oṃ saṃhāra vajra.

original: aom aom dzny'a na badzra /
analyzed: aom aom dzny'a na badzra /
translated: Oṃ oṃ jñāna vajra.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta dzny'a na badzra h'um h'um /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta dzny'a na badzra h'um h'um /
translated: Oṃ sarva tathāgata jñāna vajra hūṃ hūṃ.

original: de nas gsol pa //
analyzed: de nas gsol pa //
translated: Then, he said:

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad du zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng na rdo rjer bdag gis mthong ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad du zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng na rdo rjer bdag gis mthong ngo //
translated: “Blessed One, I see the vajra on the moon disc of all the Tathāgatas.”

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi kun du bzang po'i sems rdo rje 'di //
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi kun du bzang po'i sems rdo rje 'di //
translated: Then, the mind of all the tathāgatas is the vajra of good,

original: sngags 'dis brtan par bya'o //
analyzed: sngags 'dis brtan par bya'o //
translated: which is stabilized with this mantra:

original: aom badzra a'atma ko& h'am /
analyzed: aom badzra a'atma ko& h'am /
translated: oṃ vajra-ātmāko ’haṃ

original: de nas nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad du mnyam par 'jug pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i dbyings ji snyed pa de dag thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis sems dpa'i rdo rje der zhugs
analyzed: de nas nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad du mnyam par 'jug pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i dbyings ji snyed pa de dag thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis sems dpa'i rdo rje der zhugs
translated: Then, all the vajra realms of the body, speech, and mind of all the tathāgatas who have entered into the realm of space, all of them, through the blessing of all the tathāgatas, enter into that vajra of the mind.

original: so // de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis rdo rje'i dbyings zhes rdo rje ming gi dbang gis dbang bskur ro //
analyzed: so // de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis rdo rje'i dbyings zhes rdo rje ming gi dbang gis dbang bskur ro //
translated: Then, all the tathāgatas confer the empowerment of the vajra name, “Vajra Realm,”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku ni bdag lags par mthong ngo //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku ni bdag lags par mthong ngo //
translated: and then the Blessed One sees himself as the body of all the tathāgatas.

original: sems dpa' chen po de lta bas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sems pa'i rdo rje de rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan po'i dang rgyas kyi skur bdag nyid rang bzhin gyis grub pa'i sngags 'di ci dgar zlos la sgoms shig / aom ya
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po de lta bas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sems pa'i rdo rje de rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan po'i dang rgyas kyi skur bdag nyid rang bzhin gyis grub pa'i sngags 'di ci dgar zlos la sgoms shig / aom ya
translated: Therefore, great being, you should meditate on the mantra of the natural accomplishment of the vajra mind of all tathāgatas, endowed with the supreme of all aspects, in the form of the body of the Buddha, reciting it as much as you like: Oṃ vajra-citta-utpādayâmi.

original: tha sarba ta th'a ga ta sta th'a aa ham /
analyzed: tha sarba ta th'a ga ta sta th'a aa ham /
translated: Oṃ vajra-citta-utpādayâmi.

original: de nas bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs pa mngon par rdzogs par thams cad rgyas nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la phyag byas te 'di skad ces sol to //
analyzed: de nas bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs pa mngon par rdzogs par thams cad rgyas nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la phyag byas te 'di skad ces sol to //
translated: Then, having fully expanded the tathāgatas, having paid homage to all tathāgatas, he said this:

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad @170b kyis bdag la byin gyis rlobs la mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa 'di brtan par mdzod cig /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad @170b kyis bdag la byin gyis rlobs la mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa 'di brtan par mdzod cig /
translated: Bhagavān, all tathāgatas, please grant me your blessings and stabilize this manifest complete enlightenment.

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa rdo rje dbyings kyi sems dpa'i rdo rje der zhugs so //
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa rdo rje dbyings kyi sems dpa'i rdo rje der zhugs so //
translated: Then all tathāgatas entered the vajra of the tathāgata Vajradhātu.

original: de nas skad cig de nyid kyi tshe na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje'i mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi ye shes kyi phyag rgya gsang ba'i dam tshig tu //
analyzed: de nas skad cig de nyid kyi tshe na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so // de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje'i mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi ye shes kyi phyag rgya gsang ba'i dam tshig tu //
translated: Then, at that very moment, he fully awakened to the pristine wisdom of the equality of all the transcendent ones.🔽He entered into the secret pledge of the pristine wisdom of the vajra equality of all the transcendent ones.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje rin po che dbang bskur pa mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi phyag rgya gsang ba'i dam tshig tu zhugs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje rin po che dbang bskur pa mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi phyag rgya gsang ba'i dam tshig tu zhugs so //
translated: He entered into the secret pledge of the pristine wisdom of the vajra equality of the consecration of all the transcendent ones.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes rtogs pas rang bzhin gyis dag go //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes rtogs pas rang bzhin gyis dag go //
translated: He realized the pristine wisdom of the equality of the Dharma of all the transcendent ones, and so was naturally pure.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi las mnyam pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi 'od gsal ba'i ye shes kyi 'byung gnas su gyur pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su gyur to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi las mnyam pa nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi 'od gsal ba'i ye shes kyi 'byung gnas su gyur pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su gyur to //
translated: He became the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Fully Enlightened One, the source of the wisdom of the clear light of the nature of the equality of the activities of all Tathagatas.

original: de ltar sems so sor rtogs pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de ltar sems so sor rtogs pa nas brtsams te /
translated: Thus, beginning with the realization of the mind,

original: dkyil 'khor ba rnams kyang rang rang gi bdag nyid dang 'dra bar 'byung bar bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor ba rnams kyang rang rang gi bdag nyid dang 'dra bar 'byung bar bsam par bya ste /
translated: one should imagine that the members of the mandala arise in the likeness of their own selves,

original: rang gi sems las tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi sems las tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are of the same nature as one's own mind.

original: yang de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad kyi sems dpa'i rdo rje de las de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad byung nas //
analyzed: yang de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad kyi sems dpa'i rdo rje de las de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad byung nas //
translated: Then, from that vajra of the mind of all those Tathagatas, all the Tathagatas emerge,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes bskyed de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes bskyed de /
translated: and they generate the wisdom of the equality of all Tathagatas.

original: nam mkha' las byung ba'i nor bu rin po che'i dbang bskur bas dbang bskur //
analyzed: nam mkha' las byung ba'i nor bu rin po che'i dbang bskur bas dbang bskur //
translated: They are consecrated with the consecration of the jewel of the sky,

original: kun du spyan ras gzigs dbang pos chos kyi ye shes bskyed //
analyzed: kun du spyan ras gzigs dbang pos chos kyi ye shes bskyed //
translated: Avalokiteśvara generated the gnosis of Dharma.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi phrin las thams cad la rab tu bzhag nas //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi phrin las thams cad la rab tu bzhag nas //
translated: Having established all the activities of all the tathāgatas,

original: dkyil 'khor ba'i lha rnams kyis phyogs bzhi nas yongs su bskor te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor ba'i lha rnams kyis phyogs bzhi nas yongs su bskor te /
translated: the deities of the maṇḍala completely surrounded him from the four directions

original: lhan cig yang dag par gnas so //🔽de nas gzhan gyi don mdzad pa'i mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa yin pas byams pa dang snying rje'i mig gis sems can thams cad la bltas pa dang mi shes pa las 'dod chags dang / zhes sdang // gti mug gis dkrugs par shes nas bdag 'dir @171a * //
analyzed: lhan cig yang dag par gnas so // de nas gzhan gyi don mdzad pa'i mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa yin pas byams pa dang snying rje'i mig gis sems can thams cad la bltas pa dang mi shes pa las 'dod chags dang / zhes sdang // gti mug gis dkrugs par shes nas bdag 'dir @171a * //
translated: and remained together in the right way.🔽Then, since he was manifestly and completely enlightened for the sake of others, he looked with eyes of love and compassion at all sentient beings.

original: babs la skal pa ji lta ba bzhin du dkyil 'khor la sogs par sprul pas rjes su gzung bar bya'o zhes yid la nges par byas te /
analyzed: babs la skal pa ji lta ba bzhin du dkyil 'khor la sogs par sprul pas rjes su gzung bar bya'o zhes yid la nges par byas te /
translated: Knowing that they were disturbed by desire, hatred, and ignorance due to ignorance, he resolved in his mind, “I will descend here and guide them by emanations in maṇḍalas and so forth, in accordance with their fortune.”

original: rim pa 'dis snod kyi 'jig rten bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: rim pa 'dis snod kyi 'jig rten bskyed par bya'o //
translated: In this sequence, he should generate the world of the environment.

original: h'um yam h'um /
analyzed: h'um yam h'um /
translated: Hūṃ yaṃ hūṃ.

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: This is the maṇḍala of wind.

original: h'um bam h'um /
analyzed: h'um bam h'um /
translated: HUM BAM HUM.

original: chu'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: chu'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: This is the water mandala.

original: h'um ram h'um /
analyzed: h'um ram h'um /
translated: HUM RAM HUM.

original: me'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: me'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: This is the fire mandala.

original: de nas nam mkha' las yi ge kham las bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad bsams la /
analyzed: de nas nam mkha' las yi ge kham las bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad bsams la /
translated: Then, from space, imagine the syllable KHAM, from which comes the Bhagavat Vairochana.

original: de'i sku'i yan lag thams cad las chu'i rgyun spom po byung bas snod thams cad yongs su gang bar rnam par bsgoms la /
analyzed: de'i sku'i yan lag thams cad las chu'i rgyun spom po byung bas snod thams cad yongs su gang bar rnam par bsgoms la /
translated: From all the limbs of his body, imagine a thick stream of water, filling all the vessels.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyang de nyid du thim par gyur par rnam par bsams nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyang de nyid du thim par gyur par rnam par bsams nas /
translated: The Bhagavat dissolves into that.

original: me dang chu'i bar du h'um lam h'um zhes bya ba rnam par bkod la /
analyzed: me dang chu'i bar du h'um lam h'um zhes bya ba rnam par bkod la /
translated: Between the fire and the water, arrange HUM LAM HUM.

original: de bkod pa sngon du 'gro ba las sku rdo rje'i ting nge 'dzin brtan par gyur pa las gser gyi dkyil 'khor du bsgom //
analyzed: de bkod pa sngon du 'gro ba las sku rdo rje'i ting nge 'dzin brtan par gyur pa las gser gyi dkyil 'khor du bsgom //
translated: From the prior arrangement, the samadhi of Vajra Body becomes firm, and you imagine a golden mandala.

original: de'i steng du h'um sum h'um zhes bya ba las ri'i rgyal po ring ba bsam mo //
analyzed: de'i steng du h'um sum h'um zhes bya ba las ri'i rgyal po ring ba bsam mo //
translated: Above that, from HUM SUM HUM, imagine the king of mountains Meru.

original: de'i steng du kham las khang pa brtsegs ma rnam par bsam la /
analyzed: de'i steng du kham las khang pa brtsegs ma rnam par bsam la /
translated: Above that, from KHAM, imagine a palace.

original: de'i dbus su sa bon 'di rnams las padma la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor ba'i lha'i grangs snyed kyi gdan rnam par bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i dbus su sa bon 'di rnams las padma la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor ba'i lha'i grangs snyed kyi gdan rnam par bsam par bya ste /
translated: In the center of that, one should imagine as many seats as there are deities in the mandala, such as a lotus, etc., from these seed syllables.

original: yi ge hr'i: las thams cad du padma bsam //
analyzed: yi ge hr'i: las thams cad du padma bsam //
translated: One should imagine a lotus everywhere from the syllable hrīḥ.

original: aa si aa zhes bya ba 'dis dbus su 'khor lo can gyi seng ge'i gdan shar la sogs pa'i phyogs rnams su /
analyzed: aa si aa zhes bya ba 'dis dbus su 'khor lo can gyi seng ge'i gdan shar la sogs pa'i phyogs rnams su /
translated: By this, “aśi ā,” in the center, a lion seat with a wheel, in the east, etc., directions,

original: h'um gam h'um /
analyzed: h'um gam h'um /
translated: from the syllables hūṃ gaṃ hūṃ,

original: tram bam tram /
analyzed: tram bam tram /
translated: traṃ vaṃ traṃ,

original: hri mam hri /
analyzed: hri mam hri /
translated: hrīṃ maṃ hrīṃ,

original: aa gam aa /
analyzed: aa gam aa /
translated: aṃ gaṃ aṃ,

original: 'di dag las grangs ji lta ba bzhin du glang po che dang / rta dang / rma bya dang / nam mkha' lding gi gdan rnams bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag las grangs ji lta ba bzhin du glang po che dang / rta dang / rma bya dang / nam mkha' lding gi gdan rnams bskyed par bya'o //
translated: one should generate the seats of an elephant, horse, peacock, and garuḍa, respectively.

original: de nas mi bskyod pa la sogs pa dang lhan cig babs te /
analyzed: de nas mi bskyod pa la sogs pa dang lhan cig babs te /
translated: Then, having descended together with Akṣobhya, etc.,

original: seng ge'i gdan la legs par 'dug ste /
analyzed: seng ge'i gdan la legs par 'dug ste /
translated: one should sit well on the lion seat.

original: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas bzhi glang po che'i gdan la sogs pa nye bar gnas par bsams la /
analyzed: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas bzhi glang po che'i gdan la sogs pa nye bar gnas par bsams la /
translated: Having imagined the four buddhas, Akṣobhya, etc., situated on the elephant seat, etc.,

original: bdag nyid zhal bzhi pa byang chub mchog gi phyag rgyas gnas par bsgom zhing bcom ldan 'das rdo rje'i dbyings ni nga yin no zhes bya ba'i nga rgyal te /
analyzed: bdag nyid zhal bzhi pa byang chub mchog gi phyag rgyas gnas par bsgom zhing bcom ldan 'das rdo rje'i dbyings ni nga yin no zhes bya ba'i nga rgyal te /
translated: One should meditate on oneself as the four-faced one, abiding in the great enlightenment gesture, and have the pride that says, “The Bhagavat Vajradhātu is me.”

original: 'di ni dang po sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to /
translated: This is the samadhi called “first union.”

original: // / rje btsun 'jam dpal rnam par snang mdzad kyi tshul gyis mngon par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: // / rje btsun 'jam dpal rnam par snang mdzad kyi tshul gyis mngon par sangs rgyas te /
translated: The venerable Mañjuśrī, in the manner of Vairocana, is fully enlightened.

original: rdo rje dbyings zhes bya ba ni mtshan tsam gyis gzhan du gyur pa yin @171b pas na log par khong du chud par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings zhes bya ba ni mtshan tsam gyis gzhan du gyur pa yin @171b pas na log par khong du chud par mi bya'o //
translated: “Vajradhātu” is a mere name, and is a transformation of something else, so one should not misunderstand it.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor ba rnams rang rang gi gnas su 'og nas bshad pa'i snying pos phyag rgya chen po'i tshul du gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor ba rnams rang rang gi gnas su 'og nas bshad pa'i snying pos phyag rgya chen po'i tshul du gzhag par bya ste /
translated: Then, the maṇḍala members are placed in their own places with their own essence mantras, in the manner of the great seal.

original: 'di ni dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'di ni dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: This is the samadhi called “supreme king of maṇḍalas.”

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad byin gyis brlab pa'i rdo rje bsdu ba'i phyag rgya bcings la //
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad byin gyis brlab pa'i rdo rje bsdu ba'i phyag rgya bcings la //
translated: Then, having formed the seal of summoning the vajra of blessing all the tathagatas,🔽one should recite:

original: aom badzra sa ma y'a dza dza: h'um bam ho: zhes brjod pa /
analyzed: aom badzra sa ma y'a dza dza: h'um bam ho: zhes brjod pa /
translated: Oṃ vajra samāja ja ja hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dang bcas pa'i tshogs rnams byon pa dang / zhabs la phyag bya ba sngon du 'gro bas ched du brjod pa'i tshigs su bcad pa brjod ma thag tu bdag nyid kyi phyag rgya bzhi la zhugs par bsam mo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dang bcas pa'i tshogs rnams byon pa dang / zhabs la phyag bya ba sngon du 'gro bas ched du brjod pa'i tshigs su bcad pa brjod ma thag tu bdag nyid kyi phyag rgya bzhi la zhugs par bsam mo //
translated: Having invited the assembly of all the buddhas together with the retinue of maṇḍalas, and having made prostrations to their feet, one should imagine that one has entered into the four seals, immediately after reciting the verse of rejoicing.

original: de la phyag 'tshal ba dang / ched du brjod pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la phyag 'tshal ba dang / ched du brjod pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The prostration and rejoicing are as follows:

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta p'a ta banda nam ka ro mi ae ma'o //
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta p'a ta banda nam ka ro mi ae ma'o //
translated: Oṃ. I pay homage to the feet of all the tathagatas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni /🔽kun du bzang po'i spyod pa'i mchog / de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor lo yi ;
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni / kun du bzang po'i spyod pa'i mchog / de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor lo yi ;
translated: The bodhisattvas are:🔽The supreme conduct of Samantabhadra,🔽in the center of the wheel of the tathagatas,

original: / dbus nas de bzhin gshegs pas mdzes //
analyzed: / dbus nas de bzhin gshegs pas mdzes //
translated: is beautified by the tathagata.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de nas nus pa ma lus pa'i //
analyzed: de nas nus pa ma lus pa'i //
translated: Then, all the abilities,

original: shugs kyis byin gyis brlabs te byung nas //
analyzed: shugs kyis byin gyis brlabs te byung nas //
translated: having been empowered by the force of the mantra,

original: dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol na gnas pa'i mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i thugs kar zhugs te ched du brjod pa 'di ched du brjod cing /🔽chu dang 'o ma bzhin du gcig tu 'dres par gyur pas gnas par bsam mo //🔽de la ched du brjod pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol na gnas pa'i mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i thugs kar zhugs te ched du brjod pa 'di ched du brjod cing / chu dang 'o ma bzhin du gcig tu 'dres par gyur pas gnas par bsam mo // de la ched du brjod pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: they enter into the hearts of Akṣobhya and so forth, who are located outside the maṇḍala, and they utter this utterance:

original: ae ma 'o sangs rgyas thams cad kyi //
analyzed: ae ma 'o sangs rgyas thams cad kyi //
translated: “Amazing! All the buddhas

original: rgya chen gdod nas skye ba min //
analyzed: rgya chen gdod nas skye ba min //
translated: are vast, primordially unborn.

original: rdul phran thams cad drangs rnyed kyi //
analyzed: rdul phran thams cad drangs rnyed kyi //
translated: All the atoms of the earth are gathered

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni gcig tu gyur //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni gcig tu gyur //
translated: and the buddhas become one.”

original: de nas rnal 'byor pas dkyil 'khor ba'i lha rnams rang gi las la yang dag par sbyar nas //
analyzed: de nas rnal 'byor pas dkyil 'khor ba'i lha rnams rang gi las la yang dag par sbyar nas //
translated: Then, the yogin, having perfectly applied the deities of the maṇḍala to their own tasks,

original: de rnams kyi thugs ka'i zla ba la sngags kyi yi ge'i phreng ba bsams la /
analyzed: de rnams kyi thugs ka'i zla ba la sngags kyi yi ge'i phreng ba bsams la /
translated: visualizes the garland of mantra syllables on the moon at their hearts.

original: lan bdun rnam brgyad kyis bzlas brjod byas nas //
analyzed: lan bdun rnam brgyad kyis bzlas brjod byas nas //
translated: Having recited the mantra seven or eight times,

original: de rnams nyid kyis bdag nyid mchod par gyur par bsams pa'am //
analyzed: de rnams nyid kyis bdag nyid mchod par gyur par bsams pa'am //
translated: he imagines that they themselves make offerings to him.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag po rdo rje'i dbyings ni nga yin no zhes mchog tu yang nga rgyal bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag po rdo rje'i dbyings ni nga yin no zhes mchog tu yang nga rgyal bya ste /
translated: Thus, one should be supremely proud, thinking, “I am the lord of all the tathagatas, the vajra realm.”

original: 'di ni las kyi rgyal po mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'di ni las kyi rgyal po mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: This is the samadhi called “supreme king of actions.”

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad thal mo sbyar nas cung zad btung de /
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad thal mo sbyar nas cung zad btung de /
translated: Then, all the tathagatas, having joined their palms together, bowed down slightly and

original: mtshan brgya rtsa brgyad kyis @172a * //
analyzed: mtshan brgya rtsa brgyad kyis @172a * //
translated: praised [the Bhagavat] with the one hundred and eight names,

original: bstod pa sngon du 'gro ba dang / dkyil 'khor bri ba'i phyir gsol ba 'debs par bdag nyid tshigs su bcad pa 'dis brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: bstod pa sngon du 'gro ba dang / dkyil 'khor bri ba'i phyir gsol ba 'debs par bdag nyid tshigs su bcad pa 'dis brtag par bya'o //
