analyzed: hri badzra k'a li ru ta ma ta /
translated: Hriḥ vajra kāli rutāṃta.

original: rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi phyag rgya nyid khar bzhag la brtan par byas pas ni rdo rje nag mo'o //
analyzed: rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi phyag rgya nyid khar bzhag la brtan par byas pas ni rdo rje nag mo'o //
translated: The vajra yakṣa mudra itself is placed in the mouth and stabilized, which is the vajra black one.

original: rdo rje rtse mos lho phyogs bcing bar bya ste /
analyzed: rdo rje rtse mos lho phyogs bcing bar bya ste /
translated: Bind the south with the vajra peak.

original: aom badzra shi kha re ru ta ma ta /
analyzed: aom badzra shi kha re ru ta ma ta /
translated: Oṃ vajra śikhara rutamāta.

original: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis ri bo 'degs pa'i tshul du byas pa ni rdo rje rtse mo'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis ri bo 'degs pa'i tshul du byas pa ni rdo rje rtse mo'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The two vajra fists in the manner of lifting a mountain is the mudra of Vajra Peak.

original: rdo rje las kyi dkyil 'khor bcings la ra ba bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje las kyi dkyil 'khor bcings la ra ba bya'o //
translated: Having formed the Vajra Action maṇḍala, one should create the enclosure.

original: h'um badzra karma /🔽yang rdo rje h'um mdzad kyis ra ba bya ste /
analyzed: h'um badzra karma / yang rdo rje h'um mdzad kyis ra ba bya ste /
translated: Hūṃ vajra karma.🔽Again, with Vajra Hūṃkāra one should create the enclosure.

original: h'um rdo rje bcing bas rdo rje ra ba bya'o //
analyzed: h'um rdo rje bcing bas rdo rje ra ba bya'o //
translated: With the vajra binding, one should create the vajra enclosure with hūṃ.

original: sngags ni badzra bandha zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sngags ni badzra bandha zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The mantra is vajra bandha.

original: yang h'um aa nu r'a ga y'a mi h'um zhes bya bas dkyil 'khor bcing ba la sogs pa ni rdo rje gar las byung ba'i phyag rgya rnams kyis bya ste //
analyzed: yang h'um aa nu r'a ga y'a mi h'um zhes bya bas dkyil 'khor bcing ba la sogs pa ni rdo rje gar las byung ba'i phyag rgya rnams kyis bya ste //
translated: Again, with hūṃ aṃ ūrāgāya hūṃ, the binding of the maṇḍala and so forth should be done with the mudras arising from the vajra dance.

original: de la phyag rgya ni 'di rnams yin no //
analyzed: de la phyag rgya ni 'di rnams yin no //
translated: The mudras are as follows:

original: khro bo'i khu tshur gnyis kyi phyogs kyi 'khor lo bskor bas //
analyzed: khro bo'i khu tshur gnyis kyi phyogs kyi 'khor lo bskor bas //
translated: With the two wrathful fists, one should rotate in the directions.

original: bskor ba 'di ni dkyil 'khor bcing ba'o //
analyzed: bskor ba 'di ni dkyil 'khor bcing ba'o //
translated: This rotation is the binding of the maṇḍala.

original: khar bskor ba ni mtshams bcing ba'o //
analyzed: khar bskor ba ni mtshams bcing ba'o //
translated: Rotating in the cardinal directions is the binding of the intermediate directions.

original: snying la 'bar ltar zhugs gyur cing //
analyzed: snying la 'bar ltar zhugs gyur cing //
translated: Engaging like a fire blazing in the heart,

original: phyogs kun rdo rje me 'bar bas //
analyzed: phyogs kun rdo rje me 'bar bas //
translated: All around, blazing vajra fire.

original: nga yi'ang khro bo chen po yi //
analyzed: nga yi'ang khro bo chen po yi //
translated: Also for me, the great wrathful one,

original: 'bar ba'i rdo rje ra ba bya //
analyzed: 'bar ba'i rdo rje ra ba bya //
translated: there is the blazing vajra fence.

original: zhes bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen pos gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen pos gsungs so //
translated: Thus declares the Blessed One, Great Vajradhara.

original: aom ma h'a badzra tsa kra aa dhi tishtha siddhya h'um zhes bya ba 'di phyag rgya dang ldan pa yang byin gyis brlab bo //
analyzed: aom ma h'a badzra tsa kra aa dhi tishtha siddhya h'um zhes bya ba 'di phyag rgya dang ldan pa yang byin gyis brlab bo //
translated: With this mantra, Om, great vajra wheel, be firm, be accomplished, hum, endowed with the mudra, one should consecrate.

original: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis kyis 'khor lo bskor ba ni 'di'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis kyis 'khor lo bskor ba ni 'di'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The mudra is: with both vajra fists, rotate the wheel.

original: aom badzra mandala h'um dzdza: zhes bya ba 'dis gsang b'i gzugs can gyi dkyil 'khor bkug la /
analyzed: aom badzra mandala h'um dzdza: zhes bya ba 'dis gsang b'i gzugs can gyi dkyil 'khor bkug la /
translated: With Om, vajra mandala, hum, jjaḥ, one should summon the secret-form mandala.

original: phur bu gdab bo //
analyzed: phur bu gdab bo //
translated: Then one should drive in the stakes.

original: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis kyi mdzub mo gnyis gnyis dang / mthe bo rdo rjer byas pa ni rdo rje 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis kyi mdzub mo gnyis gnyis dang / mthe bo rdo rjer byas pa ni rdo rje 'khor lo'o //
translated: The mudra is: with both vajra fists, make the two index fingers and thumbs into vajra hooks.

original: 'dis dkyil 'khor thams cad 'gugs shing bsgrub par 'gyur la //
analyzed: 'dis dkyil 'khor thams cad 'gugs shing bsgrub par 'gyur la //
translated: With this, all mandalas are summoned and accomplished.

original: 'jig rten pa rnams kyang zhugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams kyang zhugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even worldly ones will enter.

original: de la phur bu ni 'di yin te sor brgyad pa'i tshad tsam @174a * //
analyzed: de la phur bu ni 'di yin te sor brgyad pa'i tshad tsam @174a * //
translated: The dagger is this: it is about eight finger-widths in size.🔽

original: gyis seng ldeng gi phur bu tsandan dmar pos byugs la srad bu dmar po dang / me tog dmar pos bcings la /
analyzed: gyis seng ldeng gi phur bu tsandan dmar pos byugs la srad bu dmar po dang / me tog dmar pos bcings la /
translated: The kīla is this: a kīla of khadira wood, about eight finger-breadths long, anointed with red sandalwood, bound with a red thread and a red flower,

original: stod khro bo'i gzugs la smad rdo rje rtse gcig pa'i dbyibs su 'dug pa h'um las bskyed do //
analyzed: stod khro bo'i gzugs la smad rdo rje rtse gcig pa'i dbyibs su 'dug pa h'um las bskyed do //
translated: generated from hūṃ, with an upper part in the form of a wrathful one and a lower part in the shape of a single-tined vajra.

original: aom badzra k'i li k'i la ya sarba bi ghnam bandha h'um phat ces bya ba brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas la g-yon pa'i rdo rje khu tshar gyis bzung ste /
analyzed: aom badzra k'i li k'i la ya sarba bi ghnam bandha h'um phat ces bya ba brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas la g-yon pa'i rdo rje khu tshar gyis bzung ste /
translated: Reciting one hundred and eight times the mantra, “Oṃ vajra kīla kīlaya sarva vighnān baṃha hūṃ phaṭ,” hold it with the left hand in a vajra fist,

original: g-yas pas rdo rje tho ba bzung nas //
analyzed: g-yas pas rdo rje tho ba bzung nas //
translated: and with the right hand hold a vajra hammer.

original: des dkyil 'khor gyi mtshams bzhir brdung bar bya'o //
analyzed: des dkyil 'khor gyi mtshams bzhir brdung bar bya'o //
translated: With that, strike the four directions of the maṇḍala.

original: aom ha na ha na /
analyzed: aom ha na ha na /
translated: Oṃ hana hana

original: da ma da ma /
analyzed: da ma da ma /
translated: dama dama

original: sanyts'u rn'a ya sanyts'u rn'a ya /
analyzed: sanyts'u rn'a ya sanyts'u rn'a ya /
translated: saṃcūrṇaya saṃcūrṇaya

original: badzra badzra bungga ra h'um phat ces bya ba rdo rje tho ba la lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas te me tog dmar po dang / srad bu dmar pos bcings la /
analyzed: badzra badzra bungga ra h'um phat ces bya ba rdo rje tho ba la lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas te me tog dmar po dang / srad bu dmar pos bcings la /
translated: Reciting vajra vajra bhuṃga ra hūṃ phaṭ one hundred and eight times, one should bind the red flower and red thread with the vajra hammer.

original: tsandan dmar pos byugs te /
analyzed: tsandan dmar pos byugs te /
translated: Anointed with red sandalwood,

original: des kun du brdung bar bya'o //
analyzed: des kun du brdung bar bya'o //
translated: one should beat it all around.

original: yang / bcing ba'i cho ga'i sbyor ba ni //
analyzed: yang / bcing ba'i cho ga'i sbyor ba ni //
translated: Again, the procedure of binding is:🔽One should form the vajra fist,

original: rdo rje khu tshur rab tu brtag / dkyil 'khor bsrung ba thams cad la //
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur rab tu brtag / dkyil 'khor bsrung ba thams cad la //
translated: and for all protection of the maṇḍala,

original: rdo rje go chas go cha bya //
analyzed: rdo rje go chas go cha bya //
translated: one should armor with the vajra armor.

original: de nas badzra shi kha re ru ta ma ta zhes bya bas mngon par bsngags pa'i spos chus dkyil 'khor nye bar byugs la gur kum dang / aa ka ru dang tsandan dang / ga pur dang / gla rtsi la sogs pa'i dri dang dkyil 'khor ba'i lha rnams kyi sngags kyis btab la lha rnams kyi grangs ji snyed pa'i dkyil 'khor bya'o //
analyzed: de nas badzra shi kha re ru ta ma ta zhes bya bas mngon par bsngags pa'i spos chus dkyil 'khor nye bar byugs la gur kum dang / aa ka ru dang tsandan dang / ga pur dang / gla rtsi la sogs pa'i dri dang dkyil 'khor ba'i lha rnams kyi sngags kyis btab la lha rnams kyi grangs ji snyed pa'i dkyil 'khor bya'o //
translated: Then, having anointed the maṇḍala with perfumed water, one should make a maṇḍala with as many heaps as there are deities, with the fragrance of saffron, agarwood, sandalwood, camphor, musk, and so on, and consecrated with the mantras of the maṇḍala deities.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su 'dug la yid kyis dkyil 'khor yongs su brtags te /
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su 'dug la yid kyis dkyil 'khor yongs su brtags te /
translated: Then, sitting in the center of the mandala, mentally examine the mandala.

original: dkyil 'khor de rnams su rnam par snang mdzad chen po yongs su gyur pas rje btsun 'jam dpal du gyur pa la sogs rang gi snying por bzhag la //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor de rnams su rnam par snang mdzad chen po yongs su gyur pas rje btsun 'jam dpal du gyur pa la sogs rang gi snying por bzhag la //
translated: In those mandalas, having become the Venerable Manjusri through the transformation of Great Vairocana, and so forth, place the essence of your heart.

original: mchod pa rnam pa lngas yang dag par mchod do //
analyzed: mchod pa rnam pa lngas yang dag par mchod do //
translated: Then, make offerings with the five offerings.

original: de nas dbang bskur ba'i phyir rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa sngags kyis mngon par gdab bo //
analyzed: de nas dbang bskur ba'i phyir rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa sngags kyis mngon par gdab bo //
translated: Then, in order to confer initiation, empower the victorious vase with the mantra.

original: de la cho ga ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la cho ga ni 'di yin te /
translated: The rite is as follows:

original: bam las rin po che'i rang bzhin gyi bum pa rtsa ba nag nog med pa /
analyzed: bam las rin po che'i rang bzhin gyi bum pa rtsa ba nag nog med pa /
translated: From a vase, which is the nature of jewels, arises a vase, which is without base or top,

original: lto ba che ba mgrin pa ring ba /
analyzed: lto ba che ba mgrin pa ring ba /
translated: with a large belly, a long neck,

original: kha dgye ba bskyed la /
analyzed: kha dgye ba bskyed la /
translated: and an open mouth.

original: de'i dbus su hr'i: las byung ba'i padma de'i steng du aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bsams la /
analyzed: de'i dbus su hr'i: las byung ba'i padma de'i steng du aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bsams la /
translated: In the center of that, from hriḥ arises a lotus, and on that, from aḥ arises a moon mandala.

original: der lha rnams kyi 'khor lo rang gi dam tig gis gnas pas bzhugs par bsams la /
analyzed: der lha rnams kyi 'khor lo rang gi dam tig gis gnas pas bzhugs par bsams la /
translated: There, the wheel of the deities is imagined to be present, abiding with one's own essence.

original: de las byung ba'i byang chub kyis mes kyi chus yongs su bkang bar bsam la //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i byang chub kyis mes kyi chus yongs su bkang bar bsam la //
translated: Imagine that it is filled with the water of the fire of enlightenment that arises from that.🔽It is endowed with the five medicines, the five grains, and the five precious substances, and is bound with a garland of flowers.

original: sman lnga dang / 'bru lda dang / @174b rin po che sna lnga dang ldan pa me tog gi phreng bas bcings pa'i gsang ba'i snying po can mgul pa gos gtsang mas dkris la /
analyzed: sman lnga dang / 'bru lda dang / @174b rin po che sna lnga dang ldan pa me tog gi phreng bas bcings pa'i gsang ba'i snying po can mgul pa gos gtsang mas dkris la /
translated: It has a secret essence, and its neck is wrapped with a clean cloth.

original: aa mra'i lo ma la sogs pas kha bkab pa byas la /
analyzed: aa mra'i lo ma la sogs pas kha bkab pa byas la /
translated: It is covered with a lid of mango leaves, and so forth.

original: dkyil 'khor ba'i sngags kyis mngon par bzla zhing /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor ba'i sngags kyis mngon par bzla zhing /
translated: It is consecrated with the mantra of the maṇḍala.

original: aom badzro da ka h'um h'um zhes bya ba stong rtsa brgyad bzlas brjod bya ste /
analyzed: aom badzro da ka h'um h'um zhes bya ba stong rtsa brgyad bzlas brjod bya ste /
translated: Recite the mantra oṃ vajrodaka hūṃ hūṃ one thousand and eight times.

original: spos la sogs pas mchod nas dkyil 'khor bskor te /
analyzed: spos la sogs pas mchod nas dkyil 'khor bskor te /
translated: Having made offerings with incense, and so forth, circumambulate the maṇḍala.

original: bcom ldan 'das rje btsun 'jam dpal gyi spyan sngar bzhag la dkyil 'khor gyi nyin mo dus gsum du bzlas brjod byas nas dkyil 'khor du yang bzlas brjod bya ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rje btsun 'jam dpal gyi spyan sngar bzhag la dkyil 'khor gyi nyin mo dus gsum du bzlas brjod byas nas dkyil 'khor du yang bzlas brjod bya ste /
translated: Place it in front of the Bhagavān, the Venerable Mañjuśrī. Recite the mantra three times a day on the day of the maṇḍala.

original: de nas dbang bskur bar bya'o//
analyzed: de nas dbang bskur bar bya'o//
translated: Then, perform the empowerment.

original: sang gri bya ghri krita ka rni ka ha sa de ba ste /🔽sman rnams kun zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: sang gri bya ghri krita ka rni ka ha sa de ba ste / sman rnams kun zhes bya ba la //
translated: The word all should be known to mean

original: lda po 'di dag shes par bya ste /
analyzed: lda po 'di dag shes par bya ste /
translated: the following:🔽Rice, barley, wheat, green

original: 'bras kyi so ba mon sran gre'u dang / nas dang gro dang til dang lnga //🔽'bru rnams kun zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: 'bras kyi so ba mon sran gre'u dang / nas dang gro dang til dang lnga // 'bru rnams kun zhes bya ba ni //
translated: gram, and sesame are the five grains.🔽The word all should be known to mean

original: las rnams kun la di dag gsungs //
analyzed: las rnams kun la di dag gsungs //
translated: the following:

original: byi ru gser ni sa le sbram //
analyzed: byi ru gser ni sa le sbram //
translated: Coral, gold, silver,🔽conch, pearl, and jewel

original: dung dang mu tig nor bu ste /🔽rin chen kun zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: dung dang mu tig nor bu ste / rin chen kun zhes bya ba la //
translated: are the six precious substances.🔽The word all should be known to mean

original: snga po 'di dag shes par bya //
analyzed: snga po 'di dag shes par bya //
translated: the following:

original: de nas rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi sngags dang phyag rgya dang bcas pas //
analyzed: de nas rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi sngags dang phyag rgya dang bcas pas //
translated: Then, with the mantra and mudra of Vajra Humkara,

original: las thams cad ba'i bum pa la mngon par bsngags la /
analyzed: las thams cad ba'i bum pa la mngon par bsngags la /
translated: one should incant the all-activity vase,

original: de bzhin du me tog la sogs pas yang dag par mchod de /
analyzed: de bzhin du me tog la sogs pas yang dag par mchod de /
translated: and likewise, having made offerings with flowers and so forth,

original: dkyil 'khor gyi sgor gzhag par bya //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi sgor gzhag par bya //
translated: it should be placed at the door of the mandala.

original: de la sngags dang phyag rgya ni 'di yin te /🔽aom sum bha ni sum bha h'um /
analyzed: de la sngags dang phyag rgya ni 'di yin te / aom sum bha ni sum bha h'um /
translated: The mantra and mudra are as follows:🔽Om, subjugate, subjugate, hum!

original: gri hna gri hna h'um /
analyzed: gri hna gri hna h'um /
translated: Seize, seize, hum!

original: gri hn'a pa ya gri hn'a pa ya h'um /
analyzed: gri hn'a pa ya gri hn'a pa ya h'um /
translated: Gṛhṇa gṛhṇa hūṃ.

original: a'a na ya go: bha ga b'an badzra h'um phat /
analyzed: a'a na ya go: bha ga b'an badzra h'um phat /
translated: Come, come, O Blessed Vajra, hūṃ phaṭ.

original: khro bo'i khu tshur gnyis bcings te /
analyzed: khro bo'i khu tshur gnyis bcings te /
translated: Having formed the two wrathful fists,

original: mthe'u chung rtse mo mdud byas la /
analyzed: mthe'u chung rtse mo mdud byas la /
translated: one should interlace the tips of the little fingers,

original: mdzub mo gnyis ni bsgrad ba dag /
analyzed: mdzub mo gnyis ni bsgrad ba dag /
translated: and extend the two index fingers.

original: rdo rje h'um mdzad phyag rgya 'di'o zhes bya ba 'di phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje h'um mdzad phyag rgya 'di'o zhes bya ba 'di phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the mudrā of Vajrahūṃkāra.

original: gsol ba 'di ltar gdab par bya ste /
analyzed: gsol ba 'di ltar gdab par bya ste /
translated: One should make this supplication:

original: ji srid dkyil 'khor yongs su rdzogs pa de srid du 'dir 'dug pa rnams bcom ldan 'das kyis nges par bzlog tu gsol zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ji srid dkyil 'khor yongs su rdzogs pa de srid du 'dir 'dug pa rnams bcom ldan 'das kyis nges par bzlog tu gsol zhes bya'o //
translated: For as long as the maṇḍala is completed, may the Blessed One definitely avert [harm] for those assembled here.

original: de nas phyi rol du gtor ma byin la nye reg bya ste /
analyzed: de nas phyi rol du gtor ma byin la nye reg bya ste /
translated: Then, having given the bali outside, one should perform the near-pūjā.

original: dad cing gus par phyag 'tshal te //
analyzed: dad cing gus par phyag 'tshal te //
translated: With faith and devotion, one should pay homage

original: slob ma rnams lhag par gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: slob ma rnams lhag par gnas par bya'o //
translated: and the disciples should be established in the samayas.

original: de la re zhig slob ma legs par khrus byas shing //
analyzed: de la re zhig slob ma legs par khrus byas shing //
translated: First, the disciples should be well bathed,

original: gos gtsang ma gon la lag na me tog thogs pas slob dpon la phyag bya ste /
analyzed: gos gtsang ma gon la lag na me tog thogs pas slob dpon la phyag bya ste /
translated: wearing clean clothes, holding flowers in their hands, and they should pay homage to the master.

original: 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: They should say this:

original: dga' chen khyod bdag ston @175a * //
analyzed: dga' chen khyod bdag ston @175a * //
translated: Great joy, you, my teacher,🔽master, please consider me.

original: pa bas // slob dpon khyod ni dgongs su gsol //
analyzed: pa bas // slob dpon khyod ni dgongs su gsol //
translated: I seek the great protector

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul bstan pa //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul bstan pa //
translated: who shows the way of the bodhisattva.

original: mgon po chen po bdag 'tshal lo //🔽dam tshig de nyid stsal du gsol //
analyzed: mgon po chen po bdag 'tshal lo // dam tshig de nyid stsal du gsol //
translated: Please grant me the reality commitments🔽and also the spirit of enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems kyang bdag la stsol //
analyzed: byang chub sems kyang bdag la stsol //
translated: Please grant me the three refuges

original: sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun te //🔽skyabs gsum dag ni bdag la stsol //🔽thar pa chen po'i grong mchog tu //
analyzed: sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun te // skyabs gsum dag ni bdag la stsol // thar pa chen po'i grong mchog tu //
translated: of Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha.🔽I will enter, O protector,

original: mgon po bdag ni 'jug par bgyi //
analyzed: mgon po bdag ni 'jug par bgyi //
translated: into the supreme city of great freedom.

original: de nas slob dpon gyis slob ma'i snying gar h'um las rdo rje bskyed la /
analyzed: de nas slob dpon gyis slob ma'i snying gar h'um las rdo rje bskyed la /
translated: Then the master, having generated a vajra from hūṃ in the disciple’s heart,

original: khu tshur g-yas pas bzung nas //
analyzed: khu tshur g-yas pas bzung nas //
translated: holds it with the right fist

original: rdo rje de snying gar snying po bzhag ste /
analyzed: rdo rje de snying gar snying po bzhag ste /
translated: and places the essence at the heart:

original: su ra te sa ma ya stam ho badzra siddha ya th'a su kham /

analyzed: kha sbyar byas la gzhag par bya'o //

analyzed: de la kha sbyar bya ba'i sbyor ba ni 'di yin te //

analyzed: aom h'um tr'am hr'i: aa: zhes bya ba'i dbus su steng dang 'og dang bar du dkri bar bya ba'i phyir //

analyzed: aom lnga lnga dang / yang steng du bam lnga dang / 'og tu yang h'um lnga bsam ste //

original: de ltar bdag dang dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdag dang dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya'o //

translated: On the second day, at sunrise, having bathed well and adorned with all ornaments, with great joy and mental satisfaction, having anointed the maṇḍala site with scented water, and having beautified it with flowers, etc.,

analyzed: sngon po dang // ser po dang / dmar po dang // ljang gu dang // dkar po'i kha dog dang ldan pa'i tshon dris bsgos la //

original: so so'i srad bu bcos te //
analyzed: so so'i srad bu bcos te //
translated: Having prepared the individual threads,

analyzed: rim pa bzhin du legs par bzhag la h'um tr'am hr'i: aa zhes pa'i rang gi sa bon rnams las byung ba'i srad bu'i 'od zer rnams kyis mi bskyod pa la sogs pa rang gi phyogs na bzhugs pa rnams kyi gan du btang bas 'bar blta zhing lcags kyu
translated: having arranged them in order, and having emitted the light rays of the threads arisen from one's own seed syllables, hūṃ, traṃ, hrīḥ, āḥ, one should invite Akṣobhya and so on, who reside in their respective directions, with the gaze of blazing and the hook gesture🔽held in one's hand.

original: rang gi lag pa na gnas pas drangs te //
analyzed: rang gi lag pa na gnas pas drangs te //

analyzed: de rnams kyi srad bu dbu rnams legs par bkal la //

original: aa n+yo n+ya aa nu ga ta /
analyzed: aa n+yo n+ya aa nu ga ta /
translated: “Anyonya-anugata,

analyzed: sarba dha rmma pa ra spha ra aa nu pra bishta sarba dha rmma aatahaya nata aa nu pra bishta sarba dharmma h'um zhes brjod la bsgril bar bya'o //

analyzed: de nas tsandan bzang po la sogs pas bskus pa'i gser gyi snod la sogs pa'i nang du legs par bzhag la //
translated: ” Then, having placed them well in a golden vessel, etc., anointed with good sandalwood, etc.,

original: me tog gis gtor te /
analyzed: me tog gis gtor te /
translated: scatter flowers,

analyzed: thig gdab pa'i sngags rdo rje khu tshur gyis bzung nas lan brgya rtsa brgyad yongs su bzla bar bya'o //

original: de nas bdag po rnams kyang brgya rtsa brgyad @179a * //
analyzed: de nas bdag po rnams kyang brgya rtsa brgyad @179a * //
translated: Then, the lords also, having recited one hundred and eight times,

original: bzlas te / yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad yang dag par mchod de /
analyzed: bzlas te / yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad yang dag par mchod de /
translated: having made offerings to all the tathāgatas,

analyzed: phyag byas la lang nas yid kyi rnam par snang mdzad du gyur pa'i rang gi snying ga nas grogs po rdo rje las h'um dzdza zhes bya ba 'dis phyung nas /
translated: having bowed down, having stood up, having become Mind-Vairocana, having emitted a friend from one’s vajra heart with “Hum jjaḥ”

original: ma dang ta las mig g-yas dang g-yon gnyis su nyi ma dang zla ba ser po snang ba bskyed la //
analyzed: ma dang ta las mig g-yas dang g-yon gnyis su nyi ma dang zla ba ser po snang ba bskyed la //
translated: From the letters ma and ta, the sun and moon, yellow, are generated in the two eyes, the right and the left.

analyzed: yi ge dzas grogs po'i lag tu srad bu btang //
translated: With the letter ja, the thread is placed in the friend's hand.

original: g-yon pa'i rdo rje khu tshur gyis dang po srad bu bzung la phyi nas ci bder bya'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa'i rdo rje khu tshur gyis dang po srad bu bzung la phyi nas ci bder bya'o //
translated: With the left vajra fist, first hold the thread, and then do as is convenient.

original: mkhas pa dkyil 'khor theg gdab pa //
analyzed: mkhas pa dkyil 'khor theg gdab pa //
translated: The wise one should cast the mandala🔽in the east, west,

original: shar dang nub kyi phyogs dag dang // byang dang lho yi phyogs dag tu ;
analyzed: shar dang nub kyi phyogs dag dang // byang dang lho yi phyogs dag tu ;
translated: north, and south directions.

original: / thig bzhi btab pas dkyil 'khor brgyad //
analyzed: / thig bzhi btab pas dkyil 'khor brgyad //

original: aom badzra sa ma ya s'u tram m'a ti kra ma h'um zhes bya ba 'dis sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams sems can gyi don phyir 'dir gshegs su gsol zhes yang dag par bskul la //
analyzed: aom badzra sa ma ya s'u tram m'a ti kra ma h'um zhes bya ba 'dis sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams sems can gyi don phyir 'dir gshegs su gsol zhes yang dag par bskul la //
translated: With this, Om vajra samaya sutra mantrike kramah hum, one invites all Tathagatas dwelling in the buddha-fields to come here for the sake of sentient beings.

analyzed: zur bzhi pa la sogs pa sngar bshad pa'i rim gyis thams cad thig gdab par bya ste //
translated: One should cast the lines in all directions according to the previously explained procedure of the four corners, etc.

original: chur dkyil 'khor gyi nyi ma bldab sboms su sgo'i nyi shu cha'i tshad kyi srab bus dkyil 'khor thams cad rim pa 'dis thig gdab bo //
analyzed: chur dkyil 'khor gyi nyi ma bldab sboms su sgo'i nyi shu cha'i tshad kyi srab bus dkyil 'khor thams cad rim pa 'dis thig gdab bo //
translated: The center of the mandala is the sun. The width of the mandala is twenty times the width of the door. The entire mandala is drawn with this proportion.

original: de la dang por de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la phyag byas la ;
analyzed: de la dang por de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la phyag byas la ;
translated: First, one should pay homage to all the Tathāgatas.

original: / yi ge dzdza las sgrub pa po'i grogs mchog de rdo rje las kyi gzugs su byas par btang la //
analyzed: / yi ge dzdza las sgrub pa po'i grogs mchog de rdo rje las kyi gzugs su byas par btang la //
translated: One should send that supreme friend of the practitioner, born from the letter jjaṃ, in the form of Vajrakarma.

analyzed: phyogs thams cad mnyam pa nyid du bsams nas nub phyogs kyi sgor 'dug ste //
translated: Having contemplated that all directions are the same, one should sit at the western door.

original: shar phyogs su mngon par phyogs par byas la /
analyzed: shar phyogs su mngon par phyogs par byas la /

original: lte ba'i phyogs su gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: lte ba'i phyogs su gzung bar bya'o //
translated: one should hold it at the navel level.

original: de nas bskor ba'i tshul gyis song la byang du mngon par phyogs te gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bskor ba'i tshul gyis song la byang du mngon par phyogs te gzung bar bya'o //

original: yang slar log ste //
analyzed: yang slar log ste //

analyzed: de bzhin du shar du blta ba dang // byang du blta ba bya ste //
translated: one should face east and north in the same way.

original: dbus kyis gzhir thig brkyang la //
analyzed: dbus kyis gzhir thig brkyang la //
translated: Having extended the line in the central base,

analyzed: aom badzra sa ma ya s'u tram m'a ti kra ma h'um zhes brjod de gdab par bya'o //
translated: Having recited Oṃ vajra samaya sūtra mātrikrama hūṃ, one should cast [the flower].

original: de nas me'i phyogs char 'dug la /
analyzed: de nas me'i phyogs char 'dug la /
translated: Then, having sat in the fire direction,

analyzed: byang phyogs su mngon par phyogs par phyi'i dkyil 'khor gyi shar gyi ngos su thig gdab bo //
translated: facing north, one should cast the line on the eastern side of the outer maṇḍala.

original: rlung gi phyogs su gnas nas //🔽lhor mngon par phyogs te //
analyzed: rlung gi phyogs su gnas nas // lhor mngon par phyogs te //
translated: Having stood in the wind direction,🔽facing south,

original: nub kyi phyogs kyi thig gdab bo //
analyzed: nub kyi phyogs kyi thig gdab bo //
translated: one should cast the line in the western direction.

original: de bzhin du 'dug la shar du mngon par phyogs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dug la shar du mngon par phyogs te /
translated: Having sat in the same way, facing east,

original: @179b byang phyogs kyi thig gdab bo //
analyzed: @179b byang phyogs kyi thig gdab bo //
translated: one should cast the line in the northern direction.

original: yang me'i phyogs char 'dug la nub tu mngon par phyogs te //
analyzed: yang me'i phyogs char 'dug la nub tu mngon par phyogs te //
translated: Again, having sat in the fire direction, facing west,

original: lho'i ngos mngon par thig gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: lho'i ngos mngon par thig gdab par bya'o //
translated: one should cast the line in the southern direction.

original: de bzhin du khyams kyi thig dang lha'i gnas kyi thig gdab par shes par bya ste //
analyzed: de bzhin du khyams kyi thig dang lha'i gnas kyi thig gdab par shes par bya ste //
translated: In the same way, one should understand how to cast the lines of the courtyard and the abodes of the deities.

original: thams cad du'ang slob dpon dang // sgrub pa'i grogs mchog g-yas nas bskor ba'i tshul gyi 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad du'ang slob dpon dang // sgrub pa'i grogs mchog g-yas nas bskor ba'i tshul gyi 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: In all cases, the master and the excellent friend of the practitioner should move in a clockwise direction.

original: de nas me'i mtshams su 'dug la rlung gi phyogs kyi bar du bre bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas me'i mtshams su 'dug la rlung gi phyogs kyi bar du bre bar bya'o //
translated: Then, having sat down in the southeast, he should stretch the thread to the northwest.

original: yang bden bral gyi phyogs su 'dug la //
analyzed: yang bden bral gyi phyogs su 'dug la //
translated: Again, having sat down in the southwest,

original: dbang ldan gyi phyogs kyi bar du srad bu bre bar bya ste //
analyzed: dbang ldan gyi phyogs kyi bar du srad bu bre bar bya ste //
translated: he should stretch the thread to the northeast.

original: thams cad du yang aom badzra sa ma ya s'u dzdzam m'a ti kra ma h'um zhes brjod do //
analyzed: thams cad du yang aom badzra sa ma ya s'u dzdzam m'a ti kra ma h'um zhes brjod do //
translated: In all cases, he should recite OṀ Vajra-samaya-soudha-kram-HŪṀ.

original: dza: dza: zhes bya ba'i dza gsum dang / sgrub pa po'i grogs mchog gis srad bu drang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dza: dza: zhes bya ba'i dza gsum dang / sgrub pa po'i grogs mchog gis srad bu drang bar bya'o //
translated: With the three JAs of JA JA JA, the best friend of the adept should draw the thread.

original: de la sgo thams cad ni brgyad cha'o //
analyzed: de la sgo thams cad ni brgyad cha'o //
translated: There, all the gates are one-eighth.

original: sgo khyud dang sgro 'gram dang / khyams dang // lha'i gnas ni sgo'i phyed kyi tshad do //
analyzed: sgo khyud dang sgro 'gram dang / khyams dang // lha'i gnas ni sgo'i phyed kyi tshad do //
translated: The porticoes, the side walls, the courtyard, and the abode of the gods are half the size of the gate.

original: tshon sna lnga'i sa ni khyams kyi phyed kyi tshad do //
analyzed: tshon sna lnga'i sa ni khyams kyi phyed kyi tshad do //
translated: The five-colored earth is half the size of the courtyard.

original: dkyil 'khor chen po bkod pas cha bcur gsungs pa dang // khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba las chad gur gsungs pa dang // bcu drug cha dang ldan pa yis //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor chen po bkod pas cha bcur gsungs pa dang // khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba las chad gur gsungs pa dang // bcu drug cha dang ldan pa yis //
translated: The arrangement of the great maṇḍala is said to be in ten parts, and the curtain is said to be in sixteen parts in the Trilokavijaya.

original: cha dgu dag tu bsngags pa yin //
analyzed: cha dgu dag tu bsngags pa yin //
translated: It is praised as having nine parts.

original: zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de la sgro khyud ni sgo'i tshad do //
analyzed: de la sgro khyud ni sgo'i tshad do //
translated: There, the lintel is the measure of the door.

original: de'i phyed ni sgo 'gram dang sgo logs kyi tshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyed ni sgo 'gram dang sgo logs kyi tshad do //
translated: Half of that is the measure of the doorjamb and the door recess.

original: de'i phyed ni tshon sna lnga'i sa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyed ni tshon sna lnga'i sa'o //
translated: Half of that is the ground of five colors.

original: khyams dang lha'i gnas ni sgo'i phyed du brtag par bya'o zhes pa ni rgyud gzhan las gsungs pa'i rim pas phyed pa ste 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: khyams dang lha'i gnas ni sgo'i phyed du brtag par bya'o zhes pa ni rgyud gzhan las gsungs pa'i rim pas phyed pa ste 'gal ba med do //
translated: The courtyard and the abode of the gods should be considered half of the door. This is the half according to the sequence stated in another tantra, so there is no contradiction.

original: rta babs kyi tshad ni thams cad du yang sgo'i sum pa lnga ba yin no //
analyzed: rta babs kyi tshad ni thams cad du yang sgo'i sum pa lnga ba yin no //
translated: The measure of the pediments is always one-fifth of the door.

original: phyi'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyed ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: phyi'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyed ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: Half of the outer maṇḍala is the second.

original: de'i phyed ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyed ni gsum pa'o //
translated: Half of that is the third.

original: nang gi dkyil 'khor ni zur bzhi sgo bzhi pa la rta babs med pa legs par thig btab nas //
analyzed: nang gi dkyil 'khor ni zur bzhi sgo bzhi pa la rta babs med pa legs par thig btab nas //
translated: The inner maṇḍala has four corners and four doors, without pediments, well-marked with lines.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi lte bar seng ldeng gi phur bu smad rdo rje rtse gcig pa'i dbyibs la //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi lte bar seng ldeng gi phur bu smad rdo rje rtse gcig pa'i dbyibs la //
translated: In the center of the maṇḍala, generate a khaṭvāṅga staff from hūṃ, with the lower part shaped like a single-pointed vajra

original: stod rdo rje rtse lnga pa lta bu h'um las bskyed nas //
analyzed: stod rdo rje rtse lnga pa lta bu h'um las bskyed nas //
translated: and the upper part shaped like a five-pointed vajra.

original: aom badzra k'i li k'i la ya sarba bi ghn'ana bandha ya h'um phat ces bya ba lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas la rdo rje tho bas brdung bar bya'o //
analyzed: aom badzra k'i li k'i la ya sarba bi ghn'ana bandha ya h'um phat ces bya ba lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas la rdo rje tho bas brdung bar bya'o //
translated: One should recite the mantra Oṃ vajra-kilikīlaya, bind all vighnas and vetālas, hūṃ phaṭ one hundred and eight times and strike with the vajra hammer.

original: de nas de la btags pa'i srad bus nang gi dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol rdo rje phreng ba'i thig btab pa //
analyzed: de nas de la btags pa'i srad bus nang gi dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol rdo rje phreng ba'i thig btab pa //
translated: Then, with the thread attached to that [hammer], one should draw the outer line of the inner maṇḍala with the vajra garland.

original: der dkyil 'khor brgyad 'dra bar ka @180a * //
analyzed: der dkyil 'khor brgyad 'dra bar ka @180a * //
translated: In that [maṇḍala], one should draw eight maṇḍalas like the previous one.

original: ba brgyad kyi thig kyang de bzhin du gdab par bya ste //🔽cha mnyam pa la shar phyogs kyi cha'i ka ba'i thig lho'i phyogs kyi char 'dug la byang du bltas te thig gdab bo //🔽nub phyogs kyi cha'i ka ba'i thig ni byang phyogs kyi char la 'dug la lho phyogs su blta'o //
analyzed: ba brgyad kyi thig kyang de bzhin du gdab par bya ste // cha mnyam pa la shar phyogs kyi cha'i ka ba'i thig lho'i phyogs kyi char 'dug la byang du bltas te thig gdab bo // nub phyogs kyi cha'i ka ba'i thig ni byang phyogs kyi char la 'dug la lho phyogs su blta'o //
translated: One should also draw the lines of the eight pillars in the same way.🔽In the eastern part, the line of the pillar should be placed in the southern part and face north.🔽The line of the western pillar should be placed in the northern part and face south.

original: byang phyogs kyi cha'i ka ba'i thig ni nub phyogs kyi char 'dug la shar phyogs su blta'o //
analyzed: byang phyogs kyi cha'i ka ba'i thig ni nub phyogs kyi char 'dug la shar phyogs su blta'o //
translated: The line of the northern pillar should be placed in the western part and face east.

original: lho phyogs cha'i ka ba'i thig ni shar phyogs kyi char 'dug la //
analyzed: lho phyogs cha'i ka ba'i thig ni shar phyogs kyi char 'dug la //
translated: The line of the southern direction pillar is in the eastern direction.

original: nub phyogs su mngon par bltas te thig gdab bo //
analyzed: nub phyogs su mngon par bltas te thig gdab bo //
translated: Facing west, one should lay down the line.

original: dbus kyi phur bu la btags pa'i srad bu nyid kyis phyi'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol du 'od kyi dkyil 'khor dang // bskor phyogs su phyi'i rdo rje rigs kyi gnas kyi dkyil 'khor zlum po dang // khor yug dang // khor yug chen po dag gi thig gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: dbus kyi phur bu la btags pa'i srad bu nyid kyis phyi'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol du 'od kyi dkyil 'khor dang // bskor phyogs su phyi'i rdo rje rigs kyi gnas kyi dkyil 'khor zlum po dang // khor yug dang // khor yug chen po dag gi thig gdab par bya'o //
translated: With the thread tied to the central peg, one should lay down the line of the outer circle outside the outer circle, and in the direction of circumambulation, the circle of the outer vajra realm, the surrounding mountains, and the great surrounding mountains.

original: dkyil 'khor 'dri bar byed pa na gal te 'ga' zhig 'gron tshol zhing bgegs bskyed par byed dam //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor 'dri bar byed pa na gal te 'ga' zhig 'gron tshol zhing bgegs bskyed par byed dam //
translated: If, when drawing the maṇḍala, someone seeking a guest creates an obstacle,

original: bdag nyid bgegs byed par gyur na dkyil 'khor gyi 'od kyi dkyil 'khor du grog mkhar gyi sa las lha la sogs pa'i bgegs kyi gzugs brnyan bya ste //
analyzed: bdag nyid bgegs byed par gyur na dkyil 'khor gyi 'od kyi dkyil 'khor du grog mkhar gyi sa las lha la sogs pa'i bgegs kyi gzugs brnyan bya ste //
translated: or if one oneself becomes an obstacle, in the light circle of the maṇḍala, one should make a form of a god or other obstacle out of anthill earth.

original: brgya byin gyi gzugs brnyan rang gi phyogs gnas pa la ai las brgya byin mdog ser po dang // de bzhin du me lha la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan ram las me lha mdog dmar po //
analyzed: brgya byin gyi gzugs brnyan rang gi phyogs gnas pa la ai las brgya byin mdog ser po dang // de bzhin du me lha la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan ram las me lha mdog dmar po //
translated: Similarly, the reflection of Agni, the fire god, is generated from the syllable raṃ, and Agni is red.

original: aom h'am las gshin tu rje nag po /
analyzed: aom h'am las gshin tu rje nag po /
translated: From the syllable oṃ haṃ, one generates Yama, the lord of death, who is black.

original: kam las srin po nag po //🔽bam las chu lha dkar po //
analyzed: kam las srin po nag po // bam las chu lha dkar po //
translated: From the syllable kaṃ, one generates Rākṣasa, the demon, who is black.🔽From the syllable vaṃ, one generates Varuṇa, the water god, who is white.

original: yam las rlung lha dung ka //
analyzed: yam las rlung lha dung ka //
translated: From the syllable yaṃ, one generates Vāyu, the wind god, who is blue.

original: phat las lus ngan po ser po //
analyzed: phat las lus ngan po ser po //
translated: From the syllable phaṭ, one generates Kubera, the god of wealth, who is yellow.

original: sum bha zhes bya ba las dbang ldan dkar po bskyed la rdo rje lcags kyus la sogs pas bkug ste bcug la bcings te //
analyzed: sum bha zhes bya ba las dbang ldan dkar po bskyed la rdo rje lcags kyus la sogs pas bkug ste bcug la bcings te //
translated: From the syllable suṃ, one generates Īśāna, the lord, who is white. Having summoned them with the vajra hook and so forth, one should bind them,

original: dbang du byas nas phur bus gdab bo //
analyzed: dbang du byas nas phur bus gdab bo //
translated: having subjugated them, one should drive in the dagger.

original: shin tu yang yun ring du bgags med par byed 'dod pas sas ngag ba par bya'o //
analyzed: shin tu yang yun ring du bgags med par byed 'dod pas sas ngag ba par bya'o //
translated: If one wishes to block them for a very long time, one should seal them with earth.

original: de lta na yang gal te bgegs byed na //🔽rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi sbyor bar byas la //
analyzed: de lta na yang gal te bgegs byed na // rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi sbyor bar byas la //
translated: If, despite that, they create obstacles,🔽one should perform the yoga of Vajrahūṃkāra.🔽Having summoned them with Kāyavajra, one should bind them,

original: 'dod pa'i rgyal pos bkug nas bcug la bcings te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rgyal pos bkug nas bcug la bcings te /
translated: having subjugated them, one should drive in the dagger.

original: rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi phyag rgya bcings la //
analyzed: rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi phyag rgya bcings la //
translated: Form the mudra of Vajrahūṃkāra,

original: rkang pa g-yon pas mnan te //🔽h'um bam h'um zhes bya ba la sogs pa spel ba'i tshul gyis g-yas rkyang ba'i gnas pa 'dug la //
analyzed: rkang pa g-yon pas mnan te // h'um bam h'um zhes bya ba la sogs pa spel ba'i tshul gyis g-yas rkyang ba'i gnas pa 'dug la //
translated: and trample with the left foot.🔽Sit in the posture of the right leg extended,

original: bgegs byed pa sprin la sogs pa la mngon par bltas te //
analyzed: bgegs byed pa sprin la sogs pa la mngon par bltas te //
translated: and look directly at the obstructing clouds, etc.

original: de la phyag rgya 'phangs la nam mkha'i khams @180b thams cad du sprod pas 'od zer 'bar ba kun du 'khrugs pa dang // rdo rje h'um mdzad kyis kyang rkang pos brdeg cing bsnun pas sprin la sogs pa thal bar byas par gyur pa bsams te //
analyzed: de la phyag rgya 'phangs la nam mkha'i khams @180b thams cad du sprod pas 'od zer 'bar ba kun du 'khrugs pa dang // rdo rje h'um mdzad kyis kyang rkang pos brdeg cing bsnun pas sprin la sogs pa thal bar byas par gyur pa bsams te //
translated: Throw the mudra upward and expand it throughout the realm of space, agitated by blazing light rays, and imagine that Vajrahūṃkāra tramples and strikes with his foot, reducing the clouds, etc. to dust.

original: des ni de dag bcom pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des ni de dag bcom pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: By that, they will be destroyed.

original: yang na stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin mngon du byas la /
analyzed: yang na stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin mngon du byas la /
translated: Or else, manifest the meditative concentration of emptiness.

original: de'i 'og tu aa las rnam par snang mdzad du gyur nas //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu aa las rnam par snang mdzad du gyur nas //
translated: After that, from A, become Vairocana,

original: ham las 'phags pa mi g-yo ba yid kyis thugs ka nas phyung ste //
analyzed: ham las 'phags pa mi g-yo ba yid kyis thugs ka nas phyung ste //
translated: and mentally eject Ārya Acalā from his heart.

original: badzra ham shandha zhes yid la brjod la phyi'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol du rlung gi phyogs su dris thig le bdun byas te //
analyzed: badzra ham shandha zhes yid la brjod la phyi'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol du rlung gi phyogs su dris thig le bdun byas te //
translated: Saying vajra haṃ sandha, one should imagine that outside the outer maṇḍala, in the wind direction, one makes seven drops with dust.

original: theg le re re zhing yam re re'i nang du chud par byas la //
analyzed: theg le re re zhing yam re re'i nang du chud par byas la //
translated: In each drop, one should include one yaṃ.

original: dbus ma yang yam dang thig le bdun dang ldan par bya ste //
analyzed: dbus ma yang yam dang thig le bdun dang ldan par bya ste //
translated: The central one should also have seven drops and yaṃs.

original: thig le bdun po de dag kyang rlung lha bdun par ri dags la zhon pa //
analyzed: thig le bdun po de dag kyang rlung lha bdun par ri dags la zhon pa //
translated: Those seven drops are the seven wind gods, mounted on deer,

original: mdog nag po 'phags pa mi g-yo bas //
analyzed: mdog nag po 'phags pa mi g-yo bas //
translated: black in color, and noble Acala.

original: zhags pas bcings nas bkug par gyur par bsams la //
analyzed: zhags pas bcings nas bkug par gyur par bsams la //
translated: Imagining that they are bound by a noose and summoned,

original: de rnams kyi dbus ma gcig ni gtso bo yin la //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dbus ma gcig ni gtso bo yin la //
translated: among them, one is the principal one.

original: lhag ma rlung lha drug po ni de la 'khor du bskor te kun nas gnas par bsam mo //
analyzed: lhag ma rlung lha drug po ni de la 'khor du bskor te kun nas gnas par bsam mo //
translated: The remaining six wind gods are imagined to be surrounding him.

original: de nas kham phor ma las ri rab tu bsams la //
analyzed: de nas kham phor ma las ri rab tu bsams la //
translated: Then, imagining a clay pot as Mount Meru,

original: de'i steng du dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor yi ge ma nyid las thams cad du rdo rjes g-yogs pa //
analyzed: de'i steng du dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor yi ge ma nyid las thams cad du rdo rjes g-yogs pa //
translated: on top of that, the maṇḍala of great power, from the syllable maṃ itself, is completely covered with vajras.

original: dbus su yang rdo rje rtse lnga pa yi ge h'um byung ba dang // mtshams rnams su mdung rtse rnam pa bsams la //
analyzed: dbus su yang rdo rje rtse lnga pa yi ge h'um byung ba dang // mtshams rnams su mdung rtse rnam pa bsams la //
translated: In the center, a five-pronged vajra arises from the syllable hūṃ, and in the intermediate directions, the tips of spears.

original: de bzhin du badzra ham bandha zhes brjod de kham phor de rnams kyi ji skad du bshad pa'i yam bdun dgab par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du badzra ham bandha zhes brjod de kham phor de rnams kyi ji skad du bshad pa'i yam bdun dgab par bya'o //
translated: Thus, saying vajra-haṃ-bandha, one should cover those pots with the seven yams as explained.

original: de nas kham phor dang ri rab kyi steng du aom las bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad bsams te /
analyzed: de nas kham phor dang ri rab kyi steng du aom las bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad bsams te /
translated: Then, on the pots and Mount Meru, one should visualize the Blessed One Vairocana arisen from the syllable oṃ.

original: 'phags pa mi g-yo ba yang bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar g-yon brkyang bas ri rab mnan nas ril gri dang zhags pas rlung rnams la sdigs mdzub mdzad par bsams te //
analyzed: 'phags pa mi g-yo ba yang bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar g-yon brkyang bas ri rab mnan nas ril gri dang zhags pas rlung rnams la sdigs mdzub mdzad par bsams te //
translated: And one should visualize Ārya Acala, pressing down on Mount Meru with his left leg in front of the Blessed One, and with sword and noose, threatening the winds.

original: de lta bus ni rlung thams cad bcing ba byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bus ni rlung thams cad bcing ba byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, all the winds are bound.

original: de nas chu'i bgegs bzlog pa bshad par bya ste //
analyzed: de nas chu'i bgegs bzlog pa bshad par bya ste //
translated: Next, I will explain the prevention of water obstacles.

original: ham las rlung dang me'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i 'phags pa mi g-yo bar bdag nyid bskyed la //
analyzed: ham las rlung dang me'i dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i 'phags pa mi g-yo bar bdag nyid bskyed la //
translated: Having generated oneself as Ārya Acala standing on the wind and fire maṇḍalas arisen from the syllable haṃ,

original: grog mkhar gyi sa'am /
analyzed: grog mkhar gyi sa'am /
translated: Or else, with the earth of an anthill,

original: ba lang gi lci bas ma lhung bas bgegs kyi gzugs brnyan byas nas //
analyzed: ba lang gi lci bas ma lhung bas bgegs kyi gzugs brnyan byas nas //
translated: or with cow dung, make an effigy of the obstructor.

original: kham las ral gri //
analyzed: kham las ral gri //
translated: From the syllable kham, a sword.

original: ram la me'i snying po yod pa bskyed la //
analyzed: ram la me'i snying po yod pa bskyed la //
translated: From the syllable ram, a heart of fire.

original: kshi las zhags pa dang / @181a * //
analyzed: kshi las zhags pa dang / @181a * //
translated: From the syllable kshi, a noose,

original: lcags kyu'i rang bzhin can bskyed de /🔽lag pa g-yon pas bzung la //
analyzed: lcags kyu'i rang bzhin can bskyed de / lag pa g-yon pas bzung la //
translated: and a hook, which are of the nature of iron.🔽Holding them with the left hand,

original: lag pa g-yas pas lcags kyu dang / zhags pas drangs nas bgegs kyi gzugs brnyan gyi nang du bcug ste /
analyzed: lag pa g-yas pas lcags kyu dang / zhags pas drangs nas bgegs kyi gzugs brnyan gyi nang du bcug ste /
translated: and with the right hand, drawing with the hook and the noose, insert them into the effigy of the obstructor.

original: g-yon brkyang ba'i gnas pas btsir la 'di skad ces brjod do //
analyzed: g-yon brkyang ba'i gnas pas btsir la 'di skad ces brjod do //
translated: With the posture of extended left leg, press down and say this:

original: na ma: sa manta badzr'a n'i /
analyzed: na ma: sa manta badzr'a n'i /
translated: Namo buddhāya, namo dharmāya, namaḥ saṃghāya.🔽 Cacanna mahāroṣana sphutaya hūṃ draṭa hoṃ moṃ.

original: tsanna ma h'a ro sha na spho ta ya h'um dra ta hom mom zhes brjod nas gzugs brnyan de ral gris gtub par bya'o //
analyzed: tsanna ma h'a ro sha na spho ta ya h'um dra ta hom mom zhes brjod nas gzugs brnyan de ral gris gtub par bya'o //
translated: Having said this, cut up the effigy with the sword.

original: dug dang skye tshe dang / lan tshva la sogs pas gzugs brnyan bskus la mes gdung bar bya'o //
analyzed: dug dang skye tshe dang / lan tshva la sogs pas gzugs brnyan bskus la mes gdung bar bya'o //
translated: Anoint the effigy with poison, white mustard seeds, salt, and so forth, and torment it with fire.

original: de ltar mes gdungs pas de nyid gdungs par 'gyur bar the tshom med de //
analyzed: de ltar mes gdungs pas de nyid gdungs par 'gyur bar the tshom med de //
translated: Thus, there is no doubt that he will be tormented by the fire.

original: tshangs pa'am ni brgya byin dag /
analyzed: tshangs pa'am ni brgya byin dag /
translated: Brahmā or Indra

original: de yi mod la myur du 'tshig / ces bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: de yi mod la myur du 'tshig / ces bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis gsungs so //
translated: will quickly burn him up.

original: las 'di dag kyang 'phags pa mi g-yo ba'i rnal 'byor ba'i rnal 'byor gyis 'di'i gsang sngags khri bzlas la'i sngon du bsnyen pa byas nas /
analyzed: las 'di dag kyang 'phags pa mi g-yo ba'i rnal 'byor ba'i rnal 'byor gyis 'di'i gsang sngags khri bzlas la'i sngon du bsnyen pa byas nas /
translated: These activities should be performed by one who is a practitioner of the yoga of Akṣobhya, who has performed the preliminary practice of reciting the mantra ten thousand times.

original: de'i 'og tu las bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu las bya'o //
translated: Then, one should perform the activities.

original: yang na aom a'a: h'um zhes bya ba 'di yang gshin rje gshed sku mdog nag po zhal bzhi pa phyag bzhi pa //
analyzed: yang na aom a'a: h'um zhes bya ba 'di yang gshin rje gshed sku mdog nag po zhal bzhi pa phyag bzhi pa //
translated: Alternatively, one should visualize oneself as black Kṛṣṇa Yamāri, with four faces and four hands,

original: zhabs drug pa /🔽phyag gnyis na ral gri dang dgra sta bsnams pa /
analyzed: zhabs drug pa / phyag gnyis na ral gri dang dgra sta bsnams pa /
translated: six legs,🔽holding a sword and a shield in the two right hands,

original: phyag g-yon gnyis na zhags pa dang gtun shing bsnams pa /
analyzed: phyag g-yon gnyis na zhags pa dang gtun shing bsnams pa /
translated: and a noose and a pestle in the two left hands,

original: lho phyogs su gzigs pa /
analyzed: lho phyogs su gzigs pa /
translated: gazing in the southern direction,

original: khro bo'i tshogs rnams kyis nam mkha' kun du gang bar gnas par rnam par bsams la /
analyzed: khro bo'i tshogs rnams kyis nam mkha' kun du gang bar gnas par rnam par bsams la /
translated: surrounded by a host of wrathful ones filling the whole sky.

original: mdung thung gi phyag rgya bcings te /
analyzed: mdung thung gi phyag rgya bcings te /
translated: Form the spear-dart mudra.

original: sprin la sogs pa bzlog pa'i bsams pas 'khrugs pa dang bcas pas rab tu sbyar bar bya'o /
analyzed: sprin la sogs pa bzlog pa'i bsams pas 'khrugs pa dang bcas pas rab tu sbyar bar bya'o /
translated: With the thought of warding off clouds and so forth, apply it with agitation.

original: rdo rje bsdams pa nang du bcings la /
analyzed: rdo rje bsdams pa nang du bcings la /
translated: Form the vajra-bond inside.

original: mdzub mo gnyis sbyar ba ni mdung thung gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: mdzub mo gnyis sbyar ba ni mdung thung gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The two index fingers joined is the spear-dart mudra.

original: de lta na yang gal te bgegs rnams zhi bar ma gyur na /
analyzed: de lta na yang gal te bgegs rnams zhi bar ma gyur na /
translated: If in spite of that the obstructors are not pacified,

original: kham phor so ma btang ba gnyis kyi nang du khrag dang / dud khrod kyi sol ba dang / dug dang skye tshe dang / da du ra'i lo ma'i khu bas gsang sngags bris la yungs kar la brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas brjod byas nas kham phor kha sbyar te /
analyzed: kham phor so ma btang ba gnyis kyi nang du khrag dang / dud khrod kyi sol ba dang / dug dang skye tshe dang / da du ra'i lo ma'i khu bas gsang sngags bris la yungs kar la brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas brjod byas nas kham phor kha sbyar te /
translated: write the mantra on two unfired clay bowls with blood, charnel ground ash, poison, salt, and datura leaf juice. Enchant white mustard seeds one hundred and eight times, and place them in the two bowls.

original: de'i nang du bzhag la me'i bgegs la sogs pa bsams la /🔽sreg blugs brgya'am //
analyzed: de'i nang du bzhag la me'i bgegs la sogs pa bsams la / sreg blugs brgya'am //
translated: Think of the obstructors of fire and so forth,🔽and offer one hundred oblations.

original: sreg blugs bdun sbyin sreg bya'o //
analyzed: sreg blugs bdun sbyin sreg bya'o //
translated: Or offer seven oblations.

original: de nas de dag 'jigs pa'am 'chi ba'am mi ma yin pas gzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas de dag 'jigs pa'am 'chi ba'am mi ma yin pas gzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then they will be frightened, die, or be seized by non-humans.

original: yang na rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi @181b sbyor bas yi ge h'um bzlas brjod 'bum byas la /🔽mi rus kyi rgyu las byas pa'i phur bu sor bzhi ba'i tshad tsam la lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas la de bzhin du rdo rje lcags kyu la sogs pas bkug cing bcug nas bcings te /
analyzed: yang na rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi @181b sbyor bas yi ge h'um bzlas brjod 'bum byas la / mi rus kyi rgyu las byas pa'i phur bu sor bzhi ba'i tshad tsam la lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas la de bzhin du rdo rje lcags kyu la sogs pas bkug cing bcug nas bcings te /
translated: Or else, having recited the syllable hūṃ one hundred thousand times with the application of Vajrahūṃkāra,🔽one should recite the mantra one hundred and eight times over a kīla made of human bone, four finger-widths in size.

original: gzugs brnyan phur bus gdab po //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan phur bus gdab po //
translated: Having summoned and caused to enter with the vajra hook and so forth, one should bind and drive in the kīla into the effigy.

original: de nas me'i tsha bzhi bar 'dod na /
analyzed: de nas me'i tsha bzhi bar 'dod na /
translated: If one wishes to extinguish a great fire,

original: me'i steng du bam las chu'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: me'i steng du bam las chu'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: one should visualize a water maṇḍala arisen from vaṃ on top of the fire.

original: de'i steng du padma'i dbus na gnas pa'i 'khor lo //
analyzed: de'i steng du padma'i dbus na gnas pa'i 'khor lo //
translated: In the middle of a lotus on top of that is a wheel.

original: de'i steng du bam nyid las bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad dung dang / kunda ltar dkar ba bzhugs te /
analyzed: de'i steng du bam nyid las bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad dung dang / kunda ltar dkar ba bzhugs te /
translated: On top of that, from vaṃ itself, is the Blessed One Vairocana, white like a conch or the jasmine flower.

original: mtsho chen po ma dros pa 'dra ba'i rgya mtsho chen po bzhi las chu bo bzhi 'bab pa'i char gyi rgyun dgus phyogs bcur 'gengs par gyur par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: mtsho chen po ma dros pa 'dra ba'i rgya mtsho chen po bzhi las chu bo bzhi 'bab pa'i char gyi rgyun dgus phyogs bcur 'gengs par gyur par bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should think that he fills the ten directions with the nine streams of the four rivers flowing from the four great lakes, which are like the great lake Anavatapta.

original: rdo rje spyan dang / rdo rje me ltar 'bar bas kham phor gyi ri rab dang / phur bu yang dag par bsrungs la rdo rje gnod sbyin dang / rdo rje 'jigs byed kyi spyan dag gis de rnams kyi nam mkha' bcing bar byas la //
analyzed: rdo rje spyan dang / rdo rje me ltar 'bar bas kham phor gyi ri rab dang / phur bu yang dag par bsrungs la rdo rje gnod sbyin dang / rdo rje 'jigs byed kyi spyan dag gis de rnams kyi nam mkha' bcing bar byas la //
translated: With the eyes of Vajra-Eye and Vajra-Blaze, he should guard the Mount Meru of the bowl with the stake, and with the eyes of Vajra-Yaksha and Vajra-Bhairava, he should bind the space of those with the stake.

original: rdo rje bcing bas rdo rje'i dra ba bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje bcing bas rdo rje'i dra ba bya'o //
translated: With the vajra-binding, he should make the vajra-net.

original: yang na chos thams cad ni rnam par rig pa tsam las byung ba yin la /
analyzed: yang na chos thams cad ni rnam par rig pa tsam las byung ba yin la /
translated: Or else, all phenomena arise from mere consciousness,

original: bgegs rnam skyang de'i ngo bo nyid yin pas bdag med pa'i mes thal bar byas nas //
analyzed: bgegs rnam skyang de'i ngo bo nyid yin pas bdag med pa'i mes thal bar byas nas //
translated: and the obstructors are of the nature of that. Therefore, having burned them to ashes with the fire of selflessness,

original: de'i 'og tu phyi dang nang gi bgegs rnams zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu phyi dang nang gi bgegs rnams zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: after that, the outer and inner obstructors will be pacified.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi lte ba la gnas pa'i phur bu yi ge h'um bzhis phung la phur bu'i bu ga tshon sna lngas mnyam par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi lte ba la gnas pa'i phur bu yi ge h'um bzhis phung la phur bu'i bu ga tshon sna lngas mnyam par bya'o //
translated: Then, on the center of the mandala, the stake should be pounded with the four HŪMs. The hole of the stake should be filled with the five-colored thread.

original: srad bu ni tshon dkar po dri zhim po la sbags nas gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: srad bu ni tshon dkar po dri zhim po la sbags nas gdab par bya'o //

analyzed: khro bo'i lta bas kun du bltas nas sgo rnams dbye'o //

analyzed: de yang hri las byung ba'i nyi ma dang zla ba dag / mig la rnam par bkod de sgo rnams dbye'o //

original: khro bo'i lta bar gnas pas kun bltas nas /
analyzed: khro bo'i lta bar gnas pas kun bltas nas /
translated: Abiding in the wrathful gaze, one should look everywhere.

original: de nas sgo rnams thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: de nas sgo rnams thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur zhes gsungs pas so //

original: de nas srad bu la bshad pa'i kha dog gi rim pas tshon rtsi rnams blangs la /
analyzed: de nas srad bu la bshad pa'i kha dog gi rim pas tshon rtsi rnams blangs la /

analyzed: h'um h'am hr'i: aa: aa zhes bya ba 'di rnams las bskyed de /

analyzed: rang gi rigs kyi ngo bor bsams la /

analyzed: bya'o // de la de'i phyag rgya ni 'di yin te /

analyzed: rdo rje phyag rgya gnyi ga yi //

analyzed: byas nas tshon rtsi thams cad la //

analyzed: 'bar ba'i lta bas dgug par bya //

analyzed: mthar yi ge hri dang / rdo rje padma'i phyag rgyas sbyar bar bya'o //

analyzed: de la 'bar ba'i lta ba ni 'di yin te /

analyzed: rab tu myur bar g-yo ba'i mig //

analyzed: de nas tshon mang por bya ba'i phyir //

analyzed: de nas yang dag par mchod la //

analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pas rdo rje sems dpa'i phyag rgyas tshon dkar po blangs la /

analyzed: aom badzra r'a ga sa ma ya h'um zhes brjod de //

analyzed: de'i 'og tu ci bder bya'o //

original: ser pos dgad bar bya'o //
analyzed: ser pos dgad bar bya'o //

analyzed: de nas phyi rol kun du dri zhim po'i dris nye bar byugs la /

translated: Then, in the evening, one should make offerings of song and music, and with flowers, incense, and so on, one should make offerings and examine the maṇḍala as much as one wishes.

analyzed: nam mkha'i mdzod kyi'o //

analyzed: 'od 'phro ba gtong ba lta bu ni dra ba can gyi 'od kyi'o //

analyzed: mthe bong gnyis mngon par phyogs par byas la //

analyzed: kha'i tshul du gzhag pa ni gshin rje gshed kyi'o //

analyzed: lag pa g-yon pa rdo rje khu tshur bcangs pa @186a * //
