original: las khro bo'i mdzub mo snying gar bzhag la //
analyzed: las khro bo'i mdzub mo snying gar bzhag la //
translated: From that, the threatening forefinger is placed at the heart.

original: lag pa g-yas pa thal lcag gi tshul du byas pa ni gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i 'o //🔽rdo rje khu tshur gnyis las mthe'u chung lu gu rgyud ltar mdud nas mdzub mo gzhi bas te bsgreng ba las ldog nas dpral bar gzhag pa ni rta mgrin gyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: lag pa g-yas pa thal lcag gi tshul du byas pa ni gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i 'o // rdo rje khu tshur gnyis las mthe'u chung lu gu rgyud ltar mdud nas mdzub mo gzhi bas te bsgreng ba las ldog nas dpral bar gzhag pa ni rta mgrin gyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The right hand is in the manner of a slap.🔽The two vajra fists are tied like a chain with the little fingers, and the forefingers are extended and reversed and placed on the forehead.

original: lag pa gnyis kyi mthe bos mthe bo chung gi sen mo mnan nas dpung mgo'i drud du rdo rje bcing ba'i tshul du byas te gzhag pa ni bdud rtsi thab sbyor gyi phyag rgya 'o //
analyzed: lag pa gnyis kyi mthe bos mthe bo chung gi sen mo mnan nas dpung mgo'i drud du rdo rje bcing ba'i tshul du byas te gzhag pa ni bdud rtsi thab sbyor gyi phyag rgya 'o //
translated: The thumbs of both hands press the fingernails of the little fingers, and the forearms are rubbed together in the manner of binding a vajra.

original: rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi phyag rgya nyid ni khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi phyag rgya nyid ni khams gsum rnam par rgyal ba'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The mudra of Vajra Humkara is also the mudra of Conqueror of the Three Realms.

original: rdo rje bsdams pa nang du bcings la sor mo rnams dbus su 'bar bltar byas nas mthe bo gnyis bsgreng ba ni rdo rje ltar me 'bar ba'i 'o //
analyzed: rdo rje bsdams pa nang du bcings la sor mo rnams dbus su 'bar bltar byas nas mthe bo gnyis bsgreng ba ni rdo rje ltar me 'bar ba'i 'o //
translated: The vajra fist is made by clenching the hands together, with the fingers standing up in the middle like flames, and the two thumbs erect. This is the mudra of Vajra Blazing Fire.

original: rdo rje bcing ba las mdzub mo gnyis dam du mdud la mthe bong gung mo rdo rje ltar dpral bar gzhag pa ni khrag 'thung gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje bcing ba las mdzub mo gnyis dam du mdud la mthe bong gung mo rdo rje ltar dpral bar gzhag pa ni khrag 'thung gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The vajra-binding is made by tightly binding the two index fingers together, and placing the thumbs and middle fingers like a vajra on the forehead. This is the mudra of Blood Drinker.

original: sna tshogs rdo rje ba dan gsum pa bsgreng ba ni rta mchog gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs rdo rje ba dan gsum pa bsgreng ba ni rta mchog gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The three-banner crossed vajra is made by raising the three banners. This is the mudra of Supreme Horse.

original: 'jig rten pa rnams kyi phyag rgya ni lag ba gcig mdung rtse gsum pa ltar byas la //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams kyi phyag rgya ni lag ba gcig mdung rtse gsum pa ltar byas la //
translated: The mudras of the worldly deities are made by holding up one hand like a trident.

original: mthe bos mthe'u chung mnan pa dbang ldan gyi phyag rgya'o //🔽de nyid las lag pa g-yas pa steg ste //
analyzed: mthe bos mthe'u chung mnan pa dbang ldan gyi phyag rgya'o // de nyid las lag pa g-yas pa steg ste //
translated: The mudra of Ishvara is made by pressing the thumb with the little finger.🔽 The mudra of Indra is made by raising the right hand

original: rdo rje 'dra bar byas la ni brgya byin gyi phyag rgya 'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dra bar byas la ni brgya byin gyi phyag rgya 'o //
translated: and making it like a vajra.

original: aom zhes bya ba'i lag pa la mthe bos dbus su bzhag pa ni me lha'i 'o //
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba'i lag pa la mthe bos dbus su bzhag pa ni me lha'i 'o //
translated: The mudra of Agni is made by placing the thumb in the middle of the oṃ hand.

original: mdzub mo dang mthe bo sbyar nas dbyig par byas pa ni gshin rje'i 'o //
analyzed: mdzub mo dang mthe bo sbyar nas dbyig par byas pa ni gshin rje'i 'o //
translated: The index finger and thumb joined to form a circle is the mudrā of Yama.

original: de nyid las 'khor lo lta bur byas nas gzhag pa ni khyab 'jug gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de nyid las 'khor lo lta bur byas nas gzhag pa ni khyab 'jug gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The same [mudrā] formed like a wheel is the mudrā of Viṣṇu.

original: lag pa gcig na thod pa thogs pa lta bu ni ma mo rnams kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: lag pa gcig na thod pa thogs pa lta bu ni ma mo rnams kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The mudrā of the mātṛs is holding a skull-cup in one hand.

original: sor mo gnyis bsgreng ba ni srin po rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: sor mo gnyis bsgreng ba ni srin po rnams kyi'o //
translated: The mudrā of the rākṣasas is two fingers extended.

original: mdzub mo dang mthe bo sbyar ba zhags pa ltar bya ba ni chu lha'i 'o //🔽mdzub mo dang grung mo gnyis rgyal mtshan ltar bsgreng pa ni rgyal mtshan gyi phyag rgya ste rlung lha'i 'o //
analyzed: mdzub mo dang mthe bo sbyar ba zhags pa ltar bya ba ni chu lha'i 'o // mdzub mo dang grung mo gnyis rgyal mtshan ltar bsgreng pa ni rgyal mtshan gyi phyag rgya ste rlung lha'i 'o //
translated: The mudrā of Varuṇa is the index finger and thumb like a noose.🔽The mudrā of Dhṛtarāṣṭra is the index and middle fingers extended like a banner.

original: gung mo gcig tu bsgrengs nas dbyig pa ltar bya ba'i phyag rgya ni lus dan po'i 'o //
analyzed: gung mo gcig tu bsgrengs nas dbyig pa ltar bya ba'i phyag rgya ni lus dan po'i 'o //
translated: The mudrā of Virūḍhaka is the middle finger extended like a club.

original: mchod sbyin thogs kyi phyag rgya ni tshangs pa'i 'o //🔽mdung gi phyag rgya ni drag po'i 'o //
analyzed: mchod sbyin thogs kyi phyag rgya ni tshangs pa'i 'o // mdung gi phyag rgya ni drag po'i 'o //
translated: The mudrā of Brahmā is holding a sacrificial ladle.🔽The mudrā of Rudra is a spear.

original: glang po'i sna ni tshogs kyi bdag po'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: glang po'i sna ni tshogs kyi bdag po'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The mudrā of Gaṇeśa is an elephant’s trunk.

original: bdud rtsi'i dkyil 'khor lta bu ni zla ba'i 'o //
analyzed: bdud rtsi'i dkyil 'khor lta bu ni zla ba'i 'o //
translated: The nectar mandala gesture is like the moon.

original: 'od zer stong 'gyed pa lta bu lag pa gnyis kyis bstan pa ni nyi ma'i phyag rgya'i 'o //🔽@186b pi wang brdung zhing glu len pa lta bu ni dri za rnams kyi phyag rgya'o //🔽rdza rnga brdung ba lta bu ni dga' byed dbang phyug gi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: 'od zer stong 'gyed pa lta bu lag pa gnyis kyis bstan pa ni nyi ma'i phyag rgya'i 'o // @186b pi wang brdung zhing glu len pa lta bu ni dri za rnams kyi phyag rgya'o // rdza rnga brdung ba lta bu ni dga' byed dbang phyug gi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The gesture of the two hands radiating a thousand light rays is the gesture of the sun.🔽The gesture of playing a lute and singing is the gesture of the gandharvas.🔽The gesture of beating a clay drum is the gesture of the lord of desire.

original: 'khar dkrol thogs pa lta bu ni mi'am ci'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: 'khar dkrol thogs pa lta bu ni mi'am ci'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: The gesture of holding a flute is the gesture of the kinnaras.

original: rtag par rnga brdung ba lta bu ni rig pa 'dzin pa rnams kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rtag par rnga brdung ba lta bu ni rig pa 'dzin pa rnams kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The gesture of constantly beating a drum is the gesture of the knowledge holders.

original: lag pa gnyis gdengs ka ltar bya ba ni klu rnams kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: lag pa gnyis gdengs ka ltar bya ba ni klu rnams kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The gesture of the two hands like a hood is the gesture of the nagas.

original: gzhan dag ni phyag rgya chen po nyid dam tshig gi phyag rgya ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni phyag rgya chen po nyid dam tshig gi phyag rgya ste /
translated: Others are the great seal itself or the pledge seal.

original: snying gar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor rdo rje bsgoms nas phyag rgya bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: snying gar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor rdo rje bsgoms nas phyag rgya bcing bar bya'o //
translated: Having meditated on a vajra moon mandala at the heart, one should form the seal.

original: lce la yi ge hri las padma de'i steng du aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor de'i steng du h'um las rdo rje //
analyzed: lce la yi ge hri las padma de'i steng du aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor de'i steng du h'um las rdo rje //
translated: On the tongue, from the syllable hrīḥ, a lotus; on that, from aṃ, a moon maṇḍala; on that, from hūṃ, a vajra.

original: de'i dbus su hr'i: las byung ba'i bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag tu med pa sku mdog dkar po bsams la //
analyzed: de'i dbus su hr'i: las byung ba'i bcom ldan 'das 'od dpag tu med pa sku mdog dkar po bsams la //
translated: In the middle of that, from hrīḥ, one should imagine the Blessed One Amitābha, white in color.

original: sngags kyi yi ge thams cad brjod pa ni chos kyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi yi ge thams cad brjod pa ni chos kyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: The recitation of all the mantra syllables is the dharma-mudra.

original: aa las sna tshogs rdo rje spyi bor bsams la gar las byung ba ni las kyi phyag rgya ste //
analyzed: aa las sna tshogs rdo rje spyi bor bsams la gar las byung ba ni las kyi phyag rgya ste //
translated: From aṃ, one should imagine a vajra cross on the crown of one’s head; the dance that arises from that is the karma-mudra.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la sogs pa la mchod pa la 'jug par byed pa rdo rje khu tshur bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la sogs pa la mchod pa la 'jug par byed pa rdo rje khu tshur bstan par bya'o //
translated: One should display the Vajra Fist, which engages in making offerings to all the Tathāgatas and so forth.

original: phyag rgya chen po yang ji ltar bris pa'i rjes su mthun par sa bon gyi yi ge rnams las byung bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po yang ji ltar bris pa'i rjes su mthun par sa bon gyi yi ge rnams las byung bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The great mudra should also be seen as arising from the seed syllables, in accordance with the drawing.

original: de ltar phyag rgya bzhis rgyas btab pa'i lha'i 'khor lo rnams rnam par bsgoms pa la bum pa gang ba la sogs bas ma don par mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar phyag rgya bzhis rgyas btab pa'i lha'i 'khor lo rnams rnam par bsgoms pa la bum pa gang ba la sogs bas ma don par mchod par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should worship the divine wheel sealed with the four seals without being interrupted by filling the vase, and so forth.

original: de nas rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa ji skad du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa //
analyzed: de nas rnam par rgyal ba'i bum pa ji skad du bshad pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa //
translated: Then, the victorious vase endowed with the characteristics as explained🔽is filled with the five nectars and the five meats, and one should place it in front of Mañjuśrī.

original: aom ma h'a su kha badzra aa mo gha sam yo da ka siddhya aa bhishinytsa sarba su ga so man s'u ni aa dad tu ku ru ku ru dza:h'um bam ho: aa: zhes bya bas 'jam dpal dbyangs kyi dam tshig phyag rgya rgyas bzung la /
analyzed: aom ma h'a su kha badzra aa mo gha sam yo da ka siddhya aa bhishinytsa sarba su ga so man s'u ni aa dad tu ku ru ku ru dza:h'um bam ho: aa: zhes bya bas 'jam dpal dbyangs kyi dam tshig phyag rgya rgyas bzung la /
translated: Then, having made the pledge seal of Mañjuśrī,

original: me tog gi yal ga las lan nyi shu rtsa gcig bzlas la /
analyzed: me tog gi yal ga las lan nyi shu rtsa gcig bzlas la /
translated: one should recite the mantra twenty-one times over a branch of flowers.

original: mgon po 'jam ba'i dbyangs kyi spyan sngar gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: mgon po 'jam ba'i dbyangs kyi spyan sngar gzhag par bya'o //
translated: One should place it in front of Lord Mañjughoṣa.

original: bum pa gzhan dag kyang mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan ma dang ldan pa dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol du aom badzra kro dha da ka h'um zhes lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas la /
analyzed: bum pa gzhan dag kyang mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan ma dang ldan pa dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol du aom badzra kro dha da ka h'um zhes lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas la /
translated: Also, the other vases, which are endowed with the signs of Akṣobhya, etc., are placed outside the maṇḍala.

original: gos sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa 'bum mam khri 'am //
analyzed: gos sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa 'bum mam khri 'am //
translated: One should offer a hundred thousand, ten thousand,

original: stong dam brgya'am //
analyzed: stong dam brgya'am //
translated: a thousand, a hundred,

original: so so zhing re re zhig gam /
analyzed: so so zhing re re zhig gam /
translated: or one for each [vase],

original: spyi la de bzhin du dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: spyi la de bzhin du dbul bar bya'o //
translated: or in general, in the same way.

original: de nas rim pa 'dis me tog la sogs par byang dag par mchod par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas rim pa 'dis me tog la sogs par byang dag par mchod par bya ste /
translated: Then, with this procedure, one should make offerings with flowers, etc.

original: me tog gi phyag rgya bcings la 'di skad ces brjod par @187a * //🔽bya'o // gang 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'am //
analyzed: me tog gi phyag rgya bcings la 'di skad ces brjod par @187a * // bya'o // gang 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'am //
translated: Forming the flower mudrā, one should say this:🔽“Whatever kinds of flowers there are in this world system,

original: gang yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na lha dang mi rnams kyi me tog gi bye brag yid las byung ba'am //
analyzed: gang yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na lha dang mi rnams kyi me tog gi bye brag yid las byung ba'am //
translated: or in all the world systems in the ten directions, whether divine or human,

original: chu las skyes pa'am //
analyzed: chu las skyes pa'am //
translated: whether born from water,🔽or born from the earth,🔽those I offer to all the buddhas,

original: thang las skyes pa gang dag yod pa de rnams 'di lta ste /
analyzed: thang las skyes pa gang dag yod pa de rnams 'di lta ste /
translated: together with the bodhisattvas,🔽for the sake of accomplishing the supreme siddhi.

original: ma lus shing lus pa med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa'i las bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: ma lus shing lus pa med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa'i las bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to perform the activity of making offerings to all the Tathāgatas without exception or remainder,

original: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rigs lnga dang bcas par bzhugs pa thams cad dang / snying po dang / phyag rgya dang gsang sngags dang / rig sngags kyi lha'i khyad par thams cad la dbul bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rigs lnga dang bcas par bzhugs pa thams cad dang / snying po dang / phyag rgya dang gsang sngags dang / rig sngags kyi lha'i khyad par thams cad la dbul bar bgyi'o //
translated: I offer to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas residing in the ten directions, together with the five families, and to all the special deities of essence mantras, mudrās, and knowledge mantras.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta pushpa p'u dza me gha sa su dra spa ra na sa ma ye h'um //
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta pushpa p'u dza me gha sa su dra spa ra na sa ma ye h'um //
translated: oṃ sarva tathāgata puṣpa pūja megha samudra spharaṇa samaye hūṃ

original: bdug pa'i phyag rgya bcings la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /🔽gang 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'am gang yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na //
analyzed: bdug pa'i phyag rgya bcings la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste / gang 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'am gang yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na //
translated: Form the incense mudrā and say this:🔽Whatever kinds of incense there are, whether of gods or humans,

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi bdug pa'i bye brag lhan cig skyes pa'am //
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi bdug pa'i bye brag lhan cig skyes pa'am //
translated: in this world realm or in all the world realms of the ten directions,🔽whether naturally arisen or🔽perfumed,

original: yang dag par sbyar ba'am //
analyzed: yang dag par sbyar ba'am //
translated: or transformed,

original: yongs su gyur pa gang dag yod pa de rnams 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yongs su gyur pa gang dag yod pa de rnams 'di lta ste /
translated: all of them,

original: ma lus shing lus pa mad ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa'i las bya ba'i phyir phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rigs lnga dang bcas par bzhugs pa thams cad dang / snying po dang phyag rgya dang gsang sngags dang rig sngags kyi lha'i khyad par thams cad la dbul bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: ma lus shing lus pa mad ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa'i las bya ba'i phyir phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rigs lnga dang bcas par bzhugs pa thams cad dang / snying po dang phyag rgya dang gsang sngags dang rig sngags kyi lha'i khyad par thams cad la dbul bar bgyi'o //
translated: In order to perform the activity of making offerings to all the Tathāgatas without exception or remainder, I offer to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas residing in the ten directions together with the five families, and to all the special deities of essence mantras, mudras, secret mantras, and knowledge mantras.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta dh'u pa p'u dza me gha sa bu dra spha ra nna sa ma ye h'um //
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta dh'u pa p'u dza me gha sa bu dra spha ra nna sa ma ye h'um //
translated: oṃ sarva tathāgata dhupa pūja megha samudra spharaṇa samaye hūṃ

original: mar me'i phyag rgya bcings la di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: mar me'i phyag rgya bcings la di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: Form the lamp mudra and say this:🔽Whatever distinctions of light there are of gods and humans

original: gang 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'am //
analyzed: gang 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'am //
translated: in this world system🔽or in all the world systems in the ten directions,

original: gang yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na lha dang mi rnams kyi snang ba'i bye brag yid las byung ba'am //
analyzed: gang yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na lha dang mi rnams kyi snang ba'i bye brag yid las byung ba'am //
translated: whether arisen from the mind,🔽the light of jewels, the light of lamps, and so forth,

original: rin po che'i 'od dam mar me'i snang ba la sogs pa gang dag yod pa de rnams 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rin po che'i 'od dam mar me'i snang ba la sogs pa gang dag yod pa de rnams 'di lta ste /
translated: all those

original: ma lus shing lus pa med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa'i las bya ba'i phyir phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rigs lnga dang bcas par bzhugs pa thams cad dang / snying po dang phyag rgya dang / gsang sngags dang rig sngags kyi lha'i khyad par thams @187b cad la dbul bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: ma lus shing lus pa med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa'i las bya ba'i phyir phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rigs lnga dang bcas par bzhugs pa thams cad dang / snying po dang phyag rgya dang / gsang sngags dang rig sngags kyi lha'i khyad par thams @187b cad la dbul bar bgyi'o //
translated: and to all the special deities of essence mantras, mudras, secret mantras, and knowledge mantras.

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta a'a lo ka p'u dza me gha sa mu dra spha ra na sa ma ye h'um /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga ta a'a lo ka p'u dza me gha sa mu dra spha ra na sa ma ye h'um /
translated: Oṃ sarva tathāgata ākārapūja megha samudra spharaṇa samaye hūṃ.

original: dri'i phyag rgya bcings la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dri'i phyag rgya bcings la 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: Form the mudra of scent and say this:

original: gang 'jig rten gyi khams 'di 'am //
analyzed: gang 'jig rten gyi khams 'di 'am //
translated: Whatever scents there are in this world system

original: gang yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na lha dang mi rnams kyi dri bye brag lhan cig skyes pa'am yang dag par sbyar ba'am //
analyzed: gang yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na lha dang mi rnams kyi dri bye brag lhan cig skyes pa'am yang dag par sbyar ba'am //
translated: or in all the world systems in the ten directions, whether of gods or humans, natural or compounded,🔽or whatever scents there are that have arisen from the transformation of the elements,

original: yongs su gyur pa gang dag yod pa rnams 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yongs su gyur pa gang dag yod pa rnams 'di lta ste /
translated: such as

original: ma lus shing lus pa med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad la mchod pa'i las byas pa'i phyir phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rigs lnga dang bcas par bzhugs pa thams cad dang / snying po dang phyag rgya dang /
analyzed: ma lus shing lus pa med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad la mchod pa'i las byas pa'i phyir phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rigs lnga dang bcas par bzhugs pa thams cad dang / snying po dang phyag rgya dang /
translated: In order to perform the activity of making offerings to all the Tathāgatas without exception, I offer to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas of the ten directions, together with the five families,🔽and to all the special deities of essence mantras, mudras,

original: gsang sngags dang / rig sngags kyi lha'i khyad par thams cad la dbul bar bgyi'o //
